revision.text:
'''Tommy Smith''' or '''Tommie Smith''' may refer to:
==Sports== * [[Tommy Smith (baseball)]] (born 1948), American baseball outfielder * [[Tommy Smith (basketball)]] (born 1980), American basketball player * [[Tommie Smith]] (born 1944), American track & field athlete, noted for Black Power salute at 1968 Olympics * [[Tommy Smith (jockey)]] (1937–2013), American jockey * [[Tommy J. Smith]] (1916–1998), Australian trainer of racehorses * [[Tommy L. Smith]] (1914–1985), Australian rules footballer * [[Tommy Smith (rugby union)]], 1978 rugby union winger for the USA national rugby squad, the American Cougars * [[Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1945)]], English former international footballer, spent much of his career with Liverpool * [[Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1959)]], English former footballer * [[Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1980)]], English former footballer, most notably for Watford * [[Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1990)]], New Zealand international footballer, plays for Colorado Rapids * [[Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1992)]], footballer for Huddersfield Town * [[Tommy Smith (ice hockey)]] (1886–1966), Canadian ice hockey forward
==Other== * [[Tommy Smith (playwright)]], American playwright * [[Tommy Smith (saxophonist)]] (born 1967), Scottish jazz saxophonist, composer and educator * [[Tommy Smith (DJ)]] (born 1954), radio disc jockey from Little Rock, Arkansas
==See also== *[[Thomas Smith (disambiguation)]] *[[Tom Smith (disambiguation)]] *[[Thomas Smyth (disambiguation)]]
{{hndis|name=Smith, Tommy}}

(association football)#Centre-back|Centre back]] / [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Left back]] | currentclub = [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] | clubnumber = 5 | youthyears1 = 2002–2012 | youthclubs1 = [[Feyenoord]] | years1 = 2012–2017 | clubs1 = [[Feyenoord]] | caps1 = 106 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2017–2018 | clubs2 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] | caps2 = 3 | goals2 = 0 | | nationalteam4 = Netherlands U18 | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam5 = [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands U19]] | nationalcaps5 = 10 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2013 | nationalteam6 = Netherlands U20 | nationalcaps6 = 1 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | nationalyears7 = 2013–2015 | nationalteam7 = [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] | nationalcaps7 = 6 | nationalgoals7 = 1 | nationalyears8 = 2014– | nationalteam8 = [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] | nationalcaps8 = 4 | nationalgoals8 = 0 | medaltemplates = | club-update = 09:50, 3 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 21:20, 4 June 2018 (UTC) }}
'''Terence Kongolo''' (born 14 February 1994) is a professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]]. Kongolo made his Eredivisie debut for Feyenoord during the [[2011–12 Eredivisie|2011–12 season]]. Born in Switzerland to Congolese parents, Kongolo was raised in the Netherlands and represents the [[Netherlands national football team]].
==Club career== ===Feyenoord=== Kongolo joined [[Feyenoord]] as an 8-year old. After progressing through the ranks of under-16 and under-17 side,<ref>{{cite news|title=Talent Spotter: Terence Kongolo – the Dutch destroyer who could surpass De Vrij and Martins Indi|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/166/europa-league/2014/11/27/6507451/talent-spotter-terence-kongolo-the-dutch-destroyer-who-could|publisher=Goal.com|date=27 November 2014|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> Kongolo then signed his first professional contract with the side in June 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/55620|title=Terence Kongolo tekent eerste profcontract|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=15 June 2010|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327200741/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/55620|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> A year later, he was promoted to the first team ahead of the 2011–12 season<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/53619|title=Feyenoord zonder De Vrij tegen PSV|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=4 December 2011|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327213856/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/53619|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/53588|title=Koeman houdt in Utrecht vast aan vertrouwde elftal|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=11 December 2011|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327213502/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/53588|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> and appeared on the substitute bench, around the same time playing for the reserve side. It wasn't until on 14 April 2012 when he made his debut under manager [[Ronald Koeman]], where he came on as a substitute, in 3–0 win over [[S.B.V. Excelsior|Excelsior]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/53093|title=Feyenoord kruipt dichter naar top eredivisie|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=14 April 2012|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327212240/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/53093|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> This turned out to be his only appearance of the season and at the end of the 2011–12 season, he signed a contract extension, keeping him until June 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/52775|title=Kongolo blij met nieuw contract bij Feyenoord|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=26 July 2012|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327212049/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/52775|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref>
In the 2012–13 season, Kongolo then made his first league start on 24 August 2012 against [[Heracles Almelo]] following the injury of [[Stefan de Vrij]] and the suspension of both [[Joris Mathijsen]] and [[Bruno Martins Indi]], where he played the whole game, in a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/52651|title=BASISDEBUUT KONGOLO TEGEN HERACLES ALMELO|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=26 August 2012|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327191310/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/52651|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> The following month, on 26 September 2012, he scored his first Feyenoord goal in the second round of the KNVB Cup, in a 3–2 win over [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/52536|title=FEYENOORD KRAAKT N.E.C. IN SLOTMINUUT VERLENGING|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=26 September 2012|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327192129/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/52536|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> and scored again in the third round of KNVB Cup, in a 4–0 win over [[XerxesDZB]] on 1 November 2012.<ref>{{cite news|title=Eigen doelpunt breekt ban voor Feyenoord op Kasteel|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/eigen-doelpunt-breekt-ban-voor-feyenoord-op-kasteel.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=1 November 2012|accessdate=27 March 2017}}</ref> However, Kongolo received a red card after a second bookable, just 13 minutes after receiving a yellow card, in a 2–2 draw against [[FC Groningen|Groningen]] on 7 October 2012.<ref>{{cite news|title=Tien Feyenoorders in slotfase naast slordig Groningen|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/tien-feyenoorders-in-slotfase-naast-slordig-groningen.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=7 October 2012|accessdate=27 March 2017}}</ref> As the 2012–13 season, Kongolo suffered a knee injury that kept him out for the most of the season<ref>{{cite news|title=Kongolo tot winterstop uitgeschakeld met kniekwetsuur|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/kongolo-tot-winterstop-uitgeschakeld-met-kniekwetsuur.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=20 November 2012|accessdate=27 March 2017}}</ref> and upon returning from injury, he played in the reserve for the rest of the season, scoring once against [[PSV Eindhoven]] U21 on 2 April 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/51837|title=Beloften in Eindhoven ruim langs Jong PSV|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=2 April 2013|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327213911/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/51837|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> At the end of the 2012–13 season, Kongolo went on to make five appearance for the first team side.
At the start of the 2013–14 season, Kongolo didn't feature in the first team, as he spent the start of the season, on the reserve side. At the reserve side, he appeared nine times and captained the side on five occasions.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/51408|title=Tweede remise op rij voor beloften|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=18 September 2013|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330193032/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/51408|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/feyenoord-1/uitslagen/jong-sparta-jong-feyenoord-2013/verslag|title=BAKKAL MAAKT RENTREE BIJ ZEGEVIERENDE BELOFTEN|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=30 September 2013|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330193330/https://www.feyenoord.nl/feyenoord-1/uitslagen/jong-sparta-jong-feyenoord-2013/verslag|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> It also saw Kongolo switch his shirt number from twenty-five to fifteen.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/51579|title=RUGNUMMERS SEIZOEN 2013–2014 BEKEND|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=26 June 2013|accessdate=30 March 2017}}{{dead link|date=April 2018|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref> His first appearance came on 29 September 2013 against [[ADO Den Haag]], coming on as a second half substitute, which saw them win 4–2.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/feyenoord-1/uitslagen/feyenoord-ado-den-haag-eredivisie-2013-2014/verslag|title=FEYENOORD VINDT AANSLUITING BIJ TOP EREDIVISIE|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=29 September 2013|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330195223/https://www.feyenoord.nl/feyenoord-1/uitslagen/feyenoord-ado-den-haag-eredivisie-2013-2014/verslag|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> After continuously appearing in the reserve side and making two more league appearance by the end of the 2013, Kongolo was then given a handful of first team appearances as a centre-back for the rest of the season, dispatching from [[Joris Mathijsen]]. Despite suffering a minor hip injury against [[Go Ahead Eagles]] on 30 March 2014,<ref>{{cite news|title=Opluchting bij Feyenoord over blessure Kongolo|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/opluchting-bij-feyenoord-over-blessure-kongolo.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=30 March 2014|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> Kongolo finished the 2013–14 season, making eighteen appearances in all competitions.<ref>{{cite news|title=Koeman verkiest Kongolo boven Mathijsen|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/koeman-verkiest-kongolo-boven-mathijsen.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=16 February 2014|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-tevreden-over-eigen-ontwikkeling|title=Kongolo tevreden over eigen ontwikkeling|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=6 March 2014|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330192523/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-tevreden-over-eigen-ontwikkeling|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref>
Ahead of the 2014–15 season, Kongolo's performance in the World Cup, despite playing once, attracted interests from clubs around Europe, but the club management remained confident of keeping him.<ref>{{cite news|title='99 procent zeker dat Kongolo bij Feyenoord blijft'|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/99-procent-zeker-dat-kongolo-bij-feyenoord-blijft.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=8 July 2014|accessdate=27 March 2017}}</ref> On 28 July 2014, it was announced that Kongolo signed a three-year contract with the club, keeping him until 2017 and ending his transfer speculation.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.com/news/news-overview/kongolo-pens-new-feyenoord-deal|title=KONGOLO PENS NEW FEYENOORD DEAL|publisher=Feyenoord|date=28 July 2014|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327190421/https://www.feyenoord.com/news/news-overview/kongolo-pens-new-feyenoord-deal|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> After appearing the first two league matches of the season, Kongolo was demoted to the substitute bench for two matches after losing his left-back position to youngster [[Miquel Nelom]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Rutten grijpt in en verwijst Boëtius en Kongolo naar bank|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/rutten-grijpt-in-en-verwijst-boetius-en-kongolo-naar-bank-.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=24 August 2014|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> Kongolo returned to the first team soon after when he started against [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]], which they lost 2–1.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/feyenoord-1/uitslagen/feyenoord-willem-ii-eredivisie-20142015/verslag|title=Feyenoord schrikt te laat wakker tegen Willem II|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=13 September 2014|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330202111/https://www.feyenoord.nl/feyenoord-1/uitslagen/feyenoord-willem-ii-eredivisie-20142015/verslag|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> From that moment on, Kongolo regained his first team place, mostly playing in the centre-back position, partnering with [[Sven van Beek]], for the most of the season.<ref>{{cite news|title='Van Beek en Kongolo zijn cruciaal voor spel Feyenoord'|url=http://www.ad.nl/nederlands-voetbal/van-beek-en-kongolo-zijn-cruciaal-voor-spel-feyenoord~a921fea0/|publisher=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=17 October 2014|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> Kongolo then set up one of the two goals, in a 2–0 win over [[PEC Zwolle]] on 1 November 2014.<ref>{{cite news|title=Van Beek helpt Feyenoord over dode punt heen tegen PEC Zwolle|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/van-beek-helpt-feyenoord-over-dode-punt-heen-tegen-pec.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=1 November 2014|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> Despite suffering from a groin injury,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/feyenoord-zonder-kongolo-tegen-fc-groningen|title=FEYENOORD ZONDER KONGOLO TEGEN FC GRONINGEN|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=25 April 2015|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330203701/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/feyenoord-zonder-kongolo-tegen-fc-groningen|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> Kongolo finished the 2014–15 season, making forty-five appearances in all competitions.
In the 2015–16 season, Kongolo switched number shirt again when he switched from number five to four this time following the retirement of [[Joris Mathijsen]] from club football.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/rugnummers-seizoen-2015-2016-bekend|title=Rugnummers seizoen 2015–2016 bekend|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=24 June 2015|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330203258/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/rugnummers-seizoen-2015-2016-bekend|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> Kongolo established himself in the first team as the left-back position and started the season well when he set up one of the goals, in a 2–0 win over [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]] on 23 September 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=Droomdebuut Kramer helpt Feyenoord aan zege|url=http://www.ad.nl/nederlands-voetbal/droomdebuut-kramer-helpt-feyenoord-aan-zege~a4f90167/|publisher=Algemeen Dagblad|language=Dutch|date=23 September 2015|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> Since the start of the season, Kongolo was ever-present in the first team until he was suspended for one game for picking his fourth booking this season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-%E2%80%98we-moeten-willem-ii-niet-onderschatten%E2%80%99|title=Kongolo: ‘Willem II moeten we niet onderschatten'|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=17 December 2015|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330205405/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-%E2%80%98we-moeten-willem-ii-niet-onderschatten%E2%80%99|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> After returning to the first team from suspension, Kongolo then signed a contract extension with the club, keeping him until 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-verlengt-contract-bij-feyenoord-tot-2018|title=Kongolo verlengt contract bij Feyenoord tot 2018|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=26 January 2016|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327212009/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-verlengt-contract-bij-feyenoord-tot-2018|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> However, as the 2015–16 season progressed, Kongolo suffered a hamstring injury during the match against [[SBV Vitesse|Vitesse]] and was substituted as a result. After the match, it was announced that Kongolo would be out between four and six weeks.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-weken-aan-de-kant-met-hamstringblessure|title=Hamstringblessure houdt Kongolo weken aan de kant|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=14 March 2006|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327183523/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-weken-aan-de-kant-met-hamstringblessure|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> After returning to the first team, Kongolo started in [[2015–16 KNVB Cup#Final|the final of the KNVB Cup]] against [[FC Utrecht|Utrecht]] and although he was booked, leading to [[Ramon Leeuwin]] scoring an equaliser, Kongolo helped the side win the KNVB Cup with two goals to one.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/kameraadjes/nieuws-overzicht/nieuws/feyenoord-wint-knvb-beker-2016|title=FEYENOORD WINT KNVB BEKER 2016!|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=24 April 2016|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330182518/https://www.feyenoord.nl/kameraadjes/nieuws-overzicht/nieuws/feyenoord-wint-knvb-beker-2016|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> At the end of the 2015–16 season, Kongolo went on to make thirty-five appearances in all competitions.
Ahead of the 2016–17 season, Kongolo's performance began to attract interests from European clubs, such as, [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]], [[Hamburger SV|Hamburg]] and [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] but stayed at the club throughout the summer.<ref>{{cite news|title=Sunderland, HSV en Leverkusen volgen Kongolo|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/sunderland-hsv-en-leverkusen-volgen-kongolo.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=17 May 2016|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> Kongolo continued to be a first team regular since the start of the 2016–17 season and was involved in the squad that saw Feyenoord make an impressive start, with 12 wins in the row.<ref>{{cite news|title=Eredivisie round-up: Feyenoord maintain perfect record, Ajax win again|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/10620641/eredivisie-round-up-feyenoord-maintain-perfect-record-ajax-win-again|publisher=Sky Sports|date=16 October 2016|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> During their winning streak, he scored his first professional for the side, in a 5–0 win over [[Roda JC Kerkrade|Roda]] on 25 September 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Perfect Feyenoord leidt Roda JC naar de slachtbank|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/perfect-feyenoord-leidt-roda-jc-naar-de-slachtbank.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=25 September 2016|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> Elsewhere in the UEFA Europa League, Kongolo helped Feyenoord keep two clean sheets against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Feyenoord 1–0 Manchester United: Jose Mourinho suffers second loss in five days|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/feyenoord-vs-man-utd/366948|publisher=Sky Sports|date=16 September 2016|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> and [[FC Zorya Luhansk|Zorya Luhansk]], which saw him named as UEFA Team of the Week on Matchday 1 and Matchday 3.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-in-uefa-%E2%80%98team-van-de-week%E2%80%99|title=Kongolo in UEFA ‘Team van de week’|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=16 September 2016|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330222914/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-in-uefa-%E2%80%98team-van-de-week%E2%80%99|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-opnieuw-in-uefa-%E2%80%98team-van-de-week%E2%80%99|title=Kongolo opnieuw in UEFA ‘Team van de week’|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=21 October 2016|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330212405/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-opnieuw-in-uefa-%E2%80%98team-van-de-week%E2%80%99|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> However, Kongolo suffered a hamstring injury that kept him out throughout November.<ref>{{cite news|title=Feyenoord weken zonder Kongolo door hamstringblessure|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/feyenoord-weken-zonder-kongolo-door-hamstringblessure.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=7 November 2016|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> After returning to the first team,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-fit-en-gefocust-voor-tweede-seizoenshelft|title=Kongolo fit en gefocust voor tweede seizoenshelft|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=13 January 2017|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330213646/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-fit-en-gefocust-voor-tweede-seizoenshelft|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> Kongolo captained the club the first time in his professional career in the quarter-final of the KNVB Cup against Vitesse, which saw them lose 2–0.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vitesse zet slappe titelhouder voet dwars|url=http://www.goal.com/nl/match/vitesse-vs-feyenoord/2382544/report|publisher=Goal.com|language=Dutch|date=26 January 2017|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> On 26 February 2017, Kongolo set up one of the goals, in a 2–1 win over [[PSV Eindhoven]] to continue their winning form.<ref>{{cite news|title=Feyenoord knikkert PSV uit titelrace in zinderende topper|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/feyenoord-knikkert-psv-uit-titelrace-in-zinderende-topper.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=26 February 2017|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> However, in a 1–0 loss against [[Sparta Rotterdam]], on 5 March 2017, Kongolo suffered a thigh injury in the first half and was substituted as result.<ref>{{cite news|title=Stunt Sparta tegen dramatisch Feyenoord gooit titelstrijd open|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/van-bronckhorst-niet-zeuren-over-doellijntechnologie.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=5 March 2017|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Feyenoord zonder Elia en Kongolo, Jørgensen wél inzetbaar|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/feyenoord-zonder-elia-en-kongolo-jorgensen-wel-inzetbaar.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=10 March 2017|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> After weeks on the sidelined, Kongolo managed to return to training, but continued to remain on the sidelined throughout March.<ref>{{cite news|title=Elia en Kongolo terug op trainingsveld Feyenoord|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/elia-en-kongolo-terug-op-trainingsveld-feyenoord.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=14 March 2017|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref> It wasn't until on 16 April 2017 when he returned to the first team from injury against Utrecht and setting up a goal for [[Eljero Elia]], in a 2–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/feyenoord-1/uitslagen/feyenoord-fc-utrecht-netherlands-eredivisie-2016-2017/verslag|title=Feyenoord blijft koploper dankzij tiende thuiszege op rij|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=16 April 2017|accessdate=20 May 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170520124957/https://www.feyenoord.nl/feyenoord-1/uitslagen/feyenoord-fc-utrecht-netherlands-eredivisie-2016-2017/verslag|archivedate=20 May 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> Shortly after, he signed a contract extension with the club, keeping him until 2019.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-jaar-langer-bij-feyenoord|title=Kongolo jaar langer bij Feyenoord|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=26 April 2017|accessdate=20 May 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170520124352/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-jaar-langer-bij-feyenoord|archivedate=20 May 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> Kongolo played the remaining last four matches as a left-back later in the season and helped the club win the league for the first time since 1999.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/spelers-delen-kampioensvreugde-op-social-media|title=Spelers delen kampioensvreugde op social media|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=15 May 2017|accessdate=20 May 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170520125420/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/spelers-delen-kampioensvreugde-op-social-media|archivedate=20 May 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> At the end of the 2016–17 season, he went on to make thirty-two appearances and scoring once in all competitions.
===AS Monaco=== On 3 July 2017, Kongolo transferred to [[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]], signing a five-year contract.<ref>https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/terence-kongolo-naar-as-monaco</ref>
====Huddersfield Town (loan)==== On 2 January 2018, [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] announced the signing of Kongolo on loan until the end of the 2017–18 season.<ref>{{cite web|title=LOAN: TERENCE KONGOLO JOINS FROM MONACO|url=https://www.htafc.com/news/2018/january/loan-terence-kongolo-joins-from-monaco/|website=htafc.com|publisher=Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|accessdate=2 January 2018|date=2 January 2018}}</ref>
===Huddersfield Town=== On 8 June 2018, [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] completed the permanent signing of Kongolo for an undisclosed club record fee.<ref>{{cite web|title=Terence Kongolo: Huddersfield sign Dutch defender from Monaco for club-record fee|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44421345|website=bbc.co.uk|publisher=BBC|accessdate=24 July 2018|date=8 June 2018}}</ref>
==International career==
===Youth career=== Kongolo was initially eligible to play for the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]], [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] or [[DR Congo national football team|DR Congo]]. After progressing at Netherlands U15 and Netherlands U16, Kongolo was called up by [[Netherlands national under-17 football team|Netherlands U17]] for the first time in September 2010<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-17/12370/definitieve-selectie-onder-17|title=Definitieve selectie Onder 17|publisher=Orsoranje|language=Dutch|date=6 September 2010|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327202048/http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-17/12370/definitieve-selectie-onder-17|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> and scored on his debut on 15 September 2010, in a 5–2 win over Germany U17.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-17/12970/nieuw-o-17-verliest-duitsland|title=Nieuw O-17 verliest in Duitsland|publisher=Onsoranje|language=Dutch|date=15 September 2010|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327202550/http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-17/12970/nieuw-o-17-verliest-duitsland|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref>
Kongolo was then a part of the Netherlands under-17 national team which won [[2011 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|European Championship]] in 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/54346|title=Feyenoord hofleverancier voor EK-selectie Oranje onder 17|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=26 April 2011|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327202657/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/54346|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> During the final of the Under-17 Championship against [[Germany national youth football team|Germany U17]], he scored against them for the second time in his Netherlands U17 career, which saw Netherlands U17 win 5–2.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/54279|title=Oranje onder 17 Europees kampioen|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=15 May 2011|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327203541/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/54279|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> He was also named to the Team of the Tournament.<ref>{{cite web|title=Technical report – 2011 UEFA U17 European Championship|url=https://www.uefa.com/MultimediaFiles/Download/TechnicalReport/competitions/Under17/01/64/88/25/1648825_DOWNLOAD.pdf}}</ref> The following month, Kongolo was called up again for the [[2011 FIFA U-17 World Cup]] in Mexico, but was unable to progress in the Group-Stage.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/54223|title=Zes Feyenoorders in WK-selectie Oranje onder 17|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=2 June 2011|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327202915/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/54223|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref>
After playing Netherlands U18 briefly around 2012, Kongolo was called up by [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands U19]] in August 2012<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-19/41450/34-man-voorselectie-onder-19|title=34 man in voorselectie Onder 19|publisher=Onsoranje|language=Dutch|date=22 August 2012|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327204746/http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-19/41450/34-man-voorselectie-onder-19|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> and made his Netherlands U19 debut on 10 September 2012, in a 2–1 win over [[Scotland national under-19 football team|Scotland U19]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-19/42274/winst-onder-19-schotland|title=Winst Onder 19 in Schotland|publisher=Onsoranje|language=Dutch|date=10 September 2012|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327205203/http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-19/42274/winst-onder-19-schotland|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> Kongolo went on to make ten appearance for the Netherlands U19, including playing three times in the [[2013 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|UEFA European Under-19 Championship]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-19/51626/voorlopige-selectie-onder-19|title=Voorlopige selectie Onder 19|publisher=Onsoranje|language=Dutch|date=28 June 2013|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327205924/http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-onder-19/51626/voorlopige-selectie-onder-19|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref>
Months after playing the UEFA European Under-19 Championship, Kongolo was called up by [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] for the first time in mid-August 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jong-oranje/52734/geen-rekik-en-bruns-bij-jo|title=Geen Rekik en Bruns bij JO|publisher=Onsoranje|language=Dutch|date=11 August 2013|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327210558/http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jong-oranje/52734/geen-rekik-en-bruns-bij-jo|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> Kongolo made his Netherlands U21 debut on 14 August 2013, in a 2–1 loss against [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|Czech Republic U21]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jong-oranje/52830/jong-oranje-verliest-tsjechi%C3%AB|title=Jong Oranje verliest in Tsjechië|publisher=Onsoranje|language=Dutch|date=14 August 2013|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327210608/http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jong-oranje/52830/jong-oranje-verliest-tsjechi%C3%AB|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> Around the same time, Kongolo made his Netherlands U20 debut, in a 4–0 loss against Germany U20 on 12 October 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-beloftenelftal/54390/tweede-nederlaag-voor-beloften|title=Tweede nederlaag voor Beloften|publisher=Onsoranjde|language=Dutch|date=12 October 2013|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327211203/http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jeugd-mannen-beloftenelftal/54390/tweede-nederlaag-voor-beloften|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> The following year, on 14 October 2014, Kongolo scored his first Netherlands U21 in the qualification round of UEFA European Under-21 Championship, in a 5–4 loss against [[Portugal national under-21 football team|Portugal U21]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jong-oranje/60242/jong-oranje-uitgeschakeld-5-4|title=Jong Oranje uitgeschakeld: 5–4|publisher=Onsoranje|language=Dutch|date=14 October 2014|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327211704/http://www.onsoranje.nl/nieuws/jong-oranje/60242/jong-oranje-uitgeschakeld-5-4|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref>
===Senior career===
Kongolo's performances for Feyenoord saw him included [[Netherlands national football team|senior team]] manager [[Louis Van Gaal]]'s squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vijf mogelijke debutanten aanwezig tijdens WK-stage|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/vijf-mogelijke-debutanten-aanwezig-tijdens-wkstage-.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=5 May 2014|accessdate=27 March 2017}}</ref> It wasn't until on 17 May 2014 when he made his senior national team debut, in a 1–1 draw against [[Ecuador national football team|Ecuador]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-debuteert-met-gelijkspel-in-oranje|title=Kongolo debuteert met gelijkspel in Oranje|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=17 May 2014|accessdate=27 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327190531/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-debuteert-met-gelijkspel-in-oranje|archivedate=27 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref> After the match, both van Gaal and Kongolo agreed that his performance was sloppy.<ref>{{cite news|title='Agressievere' Van Aanholt beter dan 'slordige' Kongolo|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/agressievere-van-aanholt-beter-dan-slordige-kongolo.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=17 May 2014|accessdate=27 March 2017}}</ref>
Nevertheless, Kongolo was included in the twenty-three man squad in the tournament, where he made one appearance in their final group game after entering as a substitute for [[Dirk Kuyt]] in the 89th minute against [[Chile national football team|Chile]]; the Dutch won 2–0.<ref>{{cite news|title=De cijfers van de 23 WK-gangers van Oranje op een rij|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/de-cijfers-van-de-23-wkgangers-van-oranje-op-een-rij.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=1 June 2014|accessdate=27 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Netherlands 2 – 0 Chile|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25285270|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 June 2014|accessdate=27 March 2017}}</ref> Although making one appearance in the tournament, Netherlands finished third place in the World Cup and for that, he received a bronze medal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Oranje neemt afscheid van WK: 'Heerlijk einde!|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/oranje-neemt-afscheid-van-wk-heerlijk-einde.htm|publisher=Voetbal International|language=Dutch|date=13 July 2014|accessdate=27 March 2017}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|3 January 2019}}<ref>{{cite web|title=T.Kongolo|url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/terence-kongolo/161296/|website=soccerway.com|publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=9 May 2018}}</ref> {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|National Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Continental !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |rowspan="7" valign="center"|[[Feyenoord]] |[[2011–12 Eredivisie|2011–12]] |rowspan="6" valign="center"|[[Eredivisie]] |1||0||0||0||colspan="2"|–||colspan="2"|–||colspan="2"|–||0||0 |- |[[2012–13 Eredivisie|2012–13]] |5||0||2||2||colspan="2"|–||1||0||colspan="2"|–||8||2 |- |[[2013–14 Eredivisie|2013–14]] |17||0||1||0||colspan="2"|–||0||0||colspan="2"|–||18||0 |- |[[2014–15 Eredivisie|2014–15]] |31||0||1||0||colspan="2"|–||11||0||2||0||45||0 |- |[[2015–16 Eredivisie|2015–16]] |29||0||6||0||colspan="2"|–||colspan="2"|–||colspan="2"|–||35||0 |- |[[2016–17 Eredivisie|2016–17]] |23||1||3||0||colspan="2"|–||4||0||1||0||32||1 |- !colspan="2"|Total !106!!1!!13!!2!!-!!-!!16!!0!!3!!0!!138!!3 |- |valign="center"|[[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]] |[[2017–18 AS Monaco FC season|2017–18]] |[[Ligue 1]] |3||0||0||0||1||0||1||0||1||0||6||0 |- |rowspan="3" valign="center"|[[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Huddersfield Town A.F.C. season|2017–18]] |rowspan="2" |[[Premier League]] |13||0||4||0||0||0||colspan="2"|–||colspan="2"|–||17||0 |- |[[2018–19 Huddersfield Town A.F.C. season|2018–19]] |18||1||0||0||0||0||colspan="2"|–||colspan="2"|–||18||1 |- !colspan="2"|Total !31!!1!!4!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!35!!4 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !140!!2!!17!!2!!1!!0!!17!!0!!4!!0!!179!!4 |}
==Personal life== Born in [[Fribourg]], Switzerland, to Congolese parents, Kongolo moved to the Netherlands when he was four years old and despite being raised in the Netherlands, he holds Swiss citizenship.<ref>{{cite news|title=Kongolo had voor Zwitserland kunnen spelen: "Niet echt over nagedacht"|url=http://www.feyenoordprimeur.nl/nieuws/621663/kongolo-had-voor-zwitserse-elftal-kunnen-spelen-niet-echt-over-nagedacht-.html|publisher=Feyenoord Primeur|language=Dutch|date=1 December 2015|accessdate=30 March 2017}}</ref>
Kongolo has two younger brothers: [[Rodney Kongolo|Rodney]], born in 1998, and Fidel.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://footballwonderkids.net/the-next-koemans/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-03-26 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221175340/http://footballwonderkids.net/the-next-koemans/ |archivedate=2014-02-21 |df= }} retrieved 26 March 2013.</ref>
Outside of football, Kongolo is an avid fan of basketball, especially the [[National Basketball Association|NBA]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-hard-werken-is-de-basis-van-succes|title=Kongolo: ‘Hard werken is de basis van succes’|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|date=23 February 2017|accessdate=30 March 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170330214533/https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/kongolo-hard-werken-is-de-basis-van-succes|archivedate=30 March 2017|deadurl=no}}</ref>
==Honours== ===Club=== '''Feyenoord''' * [[Eredivisie]]: [[2016–17 Eredivisie|2016–17]] * [[KNVB Cup]]: [[2015–16 KNVB Cup|2015–16]]
===International=== '''Netherlands''' * [[FIFA World Cup]] Third Place: [[2014 FIFA World Cup#Third place play-off|2014]]<ref>{{cite web|title=2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil: Brazil-Netherlands|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=255957/match=300186502/index.html|publisher=FIFA|date=12 July 2014|accessdate=21 August 2014}}</ref>

{{EngvarB|date=July 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Jonathan Hogg | image = Jonathan Hogg.jpg | image_size = 150 | caption = | fullname = Jonathan Lee Hogg<ref name="Hugman2010-11">{{Cite book | editor-first = Barry J. | editor-last = Hugman | title = The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 | year = 2010 | publisher = Mainstream Publishing | isbn = 978-1-84596-601-0 | page = 199 }}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1988|12|6|df=y}}<ref name="Hugman2010-11"/> | birth_place = [[Middlesbrough]], England | currentclub = [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] | clubnumber = 6 | height = {{height|ft=5|in=7}}<ref name="Hugman2010-11"/> | position = [[Midfielder]] | youthyears1 = 1997–2002 | youthclubs1 = [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] | youthyears2 = 2004–2009 | youthclubs2 = [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] | years1 = 2009–2011 | clubs1 = [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] | caps1 = 6 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2009–2010 | clubs2 = → [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] (loan) | caps2 = 5 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2011 | clubs3 = → [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] (loan) | caps3 = 19 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2011–2013 | clubs4 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps4 = 78 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2013– | clubs5 = [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] | caps5 = 164 | goals5 = 1 | club-update = 09:52, 3 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Jonathan Lee Hogg''' (born 6 December 1988) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] as a central [[midfielder]]. He previously played for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], and spent periods on loan at [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] and [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]].
==Career== ===Aston Villa=== Hogg was born in [[Middlesbrough]], [[North Yorkshire]].<ref name="Hugman2010-11"/> A [[midfielder]], he began his football career as a junior with hometown club [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] before joining [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.birminghammail.net/birmingham-sport/aston-villa-fc/aston-villa-news/2010/10/09/aston-villa-why-stewart-downing-is-providing-motivation-to-reserve-team-player-97319-27434502/ |title=Why Stewart Downing is providing motivation to reserve team player |first=Ken |last=Montgomery |newspaper=Birmingham Mail |date=9 October 2010 |accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> His progress was interrupted by a cruciate ligament injury in March 2007,<ref name=AVFCprofile>{{cite web |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/articles/jonathan-hogg-aston-villa_2235239_48429 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100116105210/http://www.avfc.co.uk/articles/jonathan-hogg-aston-villa_2235239_48429 |archivedate=16 January 2010 |title=Jonathan Hogg |publisher=Aston Villa F.C |accessdate=20 November 2009}}</ref> but he came back to become Villa [[reserve team]]'s leading goalscorer as they won the 2008–09 [[Premier Reserve League]] Southern section.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~1664040,00.html |title=View from the dugout |publisher=Aston Villa F.C |date=21 May 2009 |accessdate=28 March 2014}}</ref> Handed a two-year contract in July 2008,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.avfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10265~1336497,00.html |title=12 new deals |publisher=Aston Villa F.C |date=1 July 2008 |accessdate=28 March 2014}}</ref> he was part of Villa's squad that won the [[2009 Peace Cup]], a pre-season tournament.<ref name=AVFCprofile/>
On 19 August 2010, Hogg made his first competitive start for Aston Villa in the 1–1 draw away to [[SK Rapid Wien|Rapid Vienna]] in the [[2010–11 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] Play-off round. Due to injuries to several other midfield players, he made his [[Premier League]] debut in the home match against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] on 13 November 2010.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/9175395.stm |title=Aston Villa 2–2 Man Utd |first=Mandeep |last=Sangheera |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 November 2010 |accessdate=25 January 2011}}</ref> In December 2010, Hogg signed a new contract to tie him to the club until 2013.<ref name=Portsmouthloan/>
====Darlington (loan)==== In November 2009, Hogg joined [[Football League Two|League Two]]'s last-placed side [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]] on [[loan (association football)|loan]] for six weeks.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/north-east-sport/football/darlington-fc/2009/11/20/aston-villa-loan-star-jonathan-hogg-to-make-darlington-debut-84229-25213874/ |title=Aston Villa loan star Jonathan Hogg to make Darlington debut |first=Andrew |last=Wilkinson |newspaper=Evening Gazette |date=20 November 2009 |accessdate=20 November 2009}}</ref> He made his debut in [[the Football League]] on 21 November away to [[Chesterfield F.C.|Chesterfield]]; he played the whole game, and scored in the 87th minute to set up a close finish, but Chesterfield's [[Scott Boden]] scored twice very late in the game to make the final score 5–2.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/8353554.stm |title= Chesterfield 5–2 Darlington |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 November 2009 |accessdate=22 November 2009}}</ref>
====Portsmouth (loan)==== On 25 January 2011, Hogg joined [[Football League Championship|Championship]] club [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] on loan until the end of the season.<ref name=Portsmouthloan>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/p/portsmouth/9373301.stm |title=Aston Villa's Jonathan Hogg joins Portsmouth on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 September 2011 |accessdate=25 September 2011}}</ref> He made his debut the same day in a 2–1 home league defeat to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/9371582.stm |title=Portsmouth 1–2 Burnley |publisher=BBC Sport |date=25 September 2011 |accessdate=25 September 2011}}</ref>
===Watford=== Hogg joined [[Football League Championship]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] for an undisclosed fee on 27 August 2011, signing a three-year contract,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~2433550,00.html |title=Official: Hogg signs for Hornets |accessdate=27 August 2011 |date=27 August 2011 |publisher=Watford Football Club |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120917003216/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10400~2433550%2C00.html |archivedate=17 September 2012 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.player.watfordfc.com/latest-news/article/2433550|title=Official: Hogg signs for Hornets|publisher=Watford Football Club|date=27 August 2011|accessdate=28 March 2014}}{{Subscription required}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wfcforums.com/showthread.php?39547-Jonathan-Hogg&s=d27cac2adfc97fe7cfbcdbf8148fb911&p=634254&viewfull=1#post634254|title=Reproduction of aforementioned article on WFC Forums|publisher=WFC Forums|date=27 August 2011|accessdate=28 March 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160129185751/http://www.wfcforums.com/showthread.php?39547-Jonathan-Hogg&s=d27cac2adfc97fe7cfbcdbf8148fb911&p=634254&viewfull=1#post634254|archivedate=29 January 2016}}</ref> joining his former Villa youth teammate, [[Troy Deeney]], at [[Vicarage Road]] in the process. He made his debut for Watford two days later against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]'s arch-rivals, [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]]. Hogg finished the season having started 40 games in the league and came fourth in the [[Watford F.C. Player of the Season]] award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~2755071,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120502085235/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10400~2755071%2C00.html |archivedate= 2 May 2012 |title=Injury News: Relief for Hogg |accessdate=30 April 2012 |date=30 April 2012 |publisher=Watford Football Club |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
===Huddersfield Town=== Despite being a first-team regular at Watford, Hogg joined [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on a three-year contract on 29 July 2013, motivated by family reasons to request the transfer.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/130729-hogg-joins-huddersfield-952792.aspx |title=Archived copy |accessdate=29 July 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130801013644/http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/130729-hogg-joins-huddersfield-952792.aspx |archivedate=1 August 2013 }}</ref> He made his debut for the Terriers in their 1–0 defeat by [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] on 3 August. He scored his first goal for the club in the 3–2 win over [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] in the [[Football League Cup]] on 27 August 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23764062 |title=Huddersfield 3–2 Charlton |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=27 August 2013 |accessdate=20 January 2016}}</ref> His first league goal for the Terriers came in their 2–1 win over [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on 20 August 2016, his first league goal in 7 years.
For the 2016–17 season, Huddersfield Town gained promotion to the [[Premier League|English Premier League]] for the first time. Hogg was voted by his team mates the "Player's Player of the Year"<ref>{{cite web|title=Jonathan Hogg Named Player of the Season|url=http://www.jamesgrant.com/blog/jonathan-hogg-named-huddersfield-towns-players-player-year/|publisher= James Grant.com|accessdate=11 March 2018}}</ref> During that season Hogg suffered in a collision with a team mate and taken to hospital after a defeat away at [[Bristol City]] on 17 March 2017. He was initially ruled out for the remainder of the season after fears that he had fractured his neck. However after further scans, he was allowed to return less than a month later on 5 April for a victory against [[Norwich City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Jonathan Hogg: Huddersfield Town midfielder 'feared the worst' after neck injury|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39515083|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=11 March 2018}}</ref>
On 9 August 2017, manager [[David Wagner (footballer)|David Wagner]] appointed [[Tommy Smith (footballer, born 1992)|Tommy Smith]] as the [[captain (association football)|club captain]] with Hogg and German defender [[Christopher Schindler]] as [[vice-captain (association football)|his deputies]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Tommy Smith announced new club captain|url=https://www.htafc.com/news/2017/august/tommy-smith-named-new-club-captain/|publisher=Huddersfield Town|accessdate=17 October 2017}}</ref> During his 5 seasons at Huddersfield this tough tackling centre midfielder has become a crowd favourite making over 150 League and Cup appearances for the club.

F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2010–2012 | clubs2 = [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]] | caps2 = 21 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2012–2014 | clubs3 = [[Western Sydney Wanderers FC|Western Sydney Wanderers]] | caps3 = 49 | goals3 = 4 | years4 = 2014–2016 | clubs4 = [[Melbourne City FC|Melbourne City]] | caps4 = 53 | goals4 = 18 | years5 = 2016–2017 | clubs5 = [[Manchester nationalteam3 = [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]] | nationalcaps3 = 39 | nationalgoals3 = 5 | club-update = 23:55, 9 December 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 23:55, 9 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Aaron Frank Mooy''' (''[[Given name#Name at birth|né]]'' '''Kuhlman''';<ref name="adelaidenow.com.au">{{Cite web |url=http://www.adelaidenow.com.au/sport/football/a-league/teams/melbourne-city/melbourne-city-star-aaron-mooys-family-values-ground-a-player-whose-career-is-set-for-take-off/news-story/961937a402a506d0527a2079db5b14f0 |title=Melbourne City star Aaron Mooy’s family values ground a player whose career is set for take off |last= |first= |date= |website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> {{IPAc-en|m|ɔɪ|}} {{respell|MOY}};<ref>{{Citation |last=OfficialHTAFC |title=INTERVIEW: new signing Aaron Mooy on his move to HTAFC |date=5 July 2016 |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SBWqJ7zFN1I |accessdate=22 August 2017}}</ref> born 15 September 1990) is an Australian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for {{English football updater|HuddersT}} club [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] and the [[Australia national soccer team|Australian national team]].
Born in Sydney, Mooy played youth football for the [[New South Wales Institute of Sport]] and [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] before making his professional debut with [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]]. He returned to Sydney to play for [[Western Sydney Wanderers FC|Western Sydney Wanderers]] in 2012, and moved to [[Melbourne City FC|Melbourne City]] two years later. Signing for Manchester City in 2016, Mooy was immediately loaned to [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] and helped the club gain promotion to the Premier League. He signed with Huddersfield permanently in June 2017.
Mooy has been capped by the national team on 37 occasions since his debut in 2012, netting a total of five goals. He also played in the [[2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup]].
==Club career== ===Bolton Wanderers=== Mooy started his career in Europe as a youth scholar at [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]] after being spotted by [[Chris Sulley]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Aussie prospect happy at Reebok |url=http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/archive/2008/12/08/3957493.Aussie_prospect_happy_at_Reebok/ |publisher=The Bolton News |date=8 December 2008 |accessdate=15 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131224121912/http://www.theboltonnews.co.uk/archive/2008/12/08/3957493.Aussie_prospect_happy_at_Reebok/ |archivedate=24 December 2013}}</ref> He rejected a contract extension from Bolton in July 2010 in search of more first team football.<ref>{{cite web |last=Somerford |first=Ben |url=http://au.fourfourtwo.com/News/170850,mooy-quits-trotters-for-europe.aspx |title=Mooy Quits Trotters For Europe – Australia News – Australian FourFourTwo – The Ultimate Football Website |publisher=Au.fourfourtwo.com |date=3 July 2010 |accessdate=31 July 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Georgakopoulos |first=Chris |url=http://blacktown-advocate.whereilive.com.au/sport/story/western-sydney-a-league-quakers-hill-boy-aaron-mooy-named-as-one-of-first-three-wanderers/ |title=Western Sydney A-League: Quakers Hill boy Aaron Mooy named as one of first three Wanderers – Soccer – Sport – Blacktown Advocate |publisher=Blacktown-advocate.whereilive.com.au |date=25 June 2012 |accessdate=31 July 2012}}</ref>
===St Mirren=== [[File:Aaron Mooy.jpg|thumb|left|Mooy playing for [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]] in 2011]]
Mooy joined [[Scottish Premier League]] club [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]] on 23 October 2010,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://au.fourfourtwo.com/news/186712,mooy-signs-on-for-st-mirren.aspx |title=Mooy signs on for St Mirren |publisher=Au.fourfourtwo.com |date=23 October 2010 |accessdate=31 July 2012}}</ref> and made his league debut for the Saints on the same day in a 3–0 loss to [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.saintmirren.tv/articles/20101023/hearts-3-st-mirren-0_2233575_53560 |title=Hearts 3 – St Mirrens 0 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120304002804/http://www.saintmirren.tv/articles/20101023/hearts-3-st-mirren-0_2233575_53560 |archivedate=4 March 2012}}</ref> On 18 January 2011, he scored his first goal for the club, in the fourth-round replay, in a 6–1 win over [[Peterhead F.C.|Peterhead]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Scottish Cup: Peterhead 1 St Mirren 6 |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/scottish-cup-peterhead-1-st-1092597 |newspaper=Daily Record |date=19 January 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> Having made 18 appearances and scoring once in all competitions, he was offered a new contract in April 2011<ref>{{cite news |title=St Mirren offer new deal to Australian starlet Aaron Mooy |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/st-mirren-offer-new-deal-1100748 |newspaper=Daily Record |date=19 April 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> before agreeing a two-year contract with the club in May.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mooy Extends Contract at St Mirren |url=http://www.inspiresg.com/mooy-extends-contract-at-st-mirren |publisher=Inspire Sports Management |date=18 May 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110529110538/http://www.inspiresg.com/mooy-extends-contract-at-st-mirren |archivedate=29 May 2011}}</ref>
The 2011–12 season was marked by Mooy having suffered a stress fracture in his back<!-- following a scan-->.<ref>{{cite news |title=Dutch defender Jeroen Tesselaar agrees St Mirren deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/14164057 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 July 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> As months went by, his recovery started going well.<ref>{{cite news |title=Rehab going well for St Mirren ace Aaron Mooy as he recovers from back injury |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/rehab-going-well-for-st-mirren-1081328 |newspaper=Daily Record |date=9 September 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> Soon after, he went to a specialist to get over his injury.<ref>{{cite news |title=St Mirren hope specialist can get to bottom of Aaron Mooy back injury |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/st-mirren-hope-specialist-can-1085864 |newspaper=Daily Record |date=3 November 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> On 17 December 2011, Mooy made his return, coming as a substitute, in a 1–1 draw against [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]]<ref>{{cite news |title=Motherwell 1 – 1 St Mirren |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16123540 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 December 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> and the next game, he scored his first league goal for the club against [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] at [[St Mirren Park]] on Christmas Eve 2011.<ref>{{cite news |title=SPL: St Mirren 2 Rangers 1 |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/spl-st-mirren-2-rangers-1090506 |newspaper=Daily Record |date=26 December 2011 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref>
===Western Sydney Wanderers=== [[File:Western Sydney Wanderers Launch Photo Three Players.png|thumb|left|Mooy (left) at the Western Sydney Wanderers launch, along with [[Tarek Elrich]] and [[Kwabena Appiah]]]][[File:Luke Brattan in action (8398838212).jpg|thumb|right|252px|Mooy playing for [[Western Sydney Wanderers FC|Western Sydney Wanderers]] against [[Brisbane Roar FC|Brisbane Roar]]'s [[Luke Brattan]] in 2013]]
After leaving St Mirren on a free transfer, Mooy returned to Australia and was announced as one of the three inaugural signings for new A-League club [[Western Sydney Wanderers FC|Western Sydney Wanderers]] on 25 June.<ref name="1st 3 WS Players">{{cite web |url=http://www.footballaustralia.com.au/wswanderersfc/news-display/Western-Sydney-reveal-first-players/47853 |title=Western Sydney reveal first players |date=25 June 2012 |publisher=Football Federation Australia |accessdate=25 June 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140529052556/http://www.footballaustralia.com.au/wswanderersfc/news-display/Western-Sydney-reveal-first-players/47853 |archivedate=29 May 2014}}</ref> He made his debut in the opening game of the season in a 0–0 draw against [[Central Coast Mariners FC|Central Coast Mariners]]<ref>{{cite news |title=Match Report: Western Sydney Wanderers vs Central Coast Mariners |url=http://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/match/stats/241581/Western-Sydney-Wanderers-vs-Central-Coast-Mariners/ |publisher=The World Game |date=6 October 2012 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> and on 23 February 2013, he scored his first goal, in a 1–0 win over [[Perth Glory FC|Perth Glory]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Match Report: Western Sydney Wanderers vs Perth Glory |url=http://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/match/stats/241789/Western-Sydney-Wanderers-vs-Perth-Glory/ |publisher=The World Game |date=23 February 2013 |accessdate=15 August 2013}}</ref> He made 23 appearances and scored one goal in his first season with the Wanderers, who won the Premiership and made the grand final in their inaugural season. Mooy took part in his second successive A-League grand final the following season, as the Wanderers were named runners-up to the Championship for the second time in a row.
===Melbourne City=== Mooy was released by Western Sydney Wanderers on 21 May 2014,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.footballaustralia.com.au/wswanderersfc/news-display/Wanderers-Announce-Player-Departures/90596 |title=Wanderers Announce Player Departures |date=21 May 2014 |publisher=Western Sydney Wanderers FC |accessdate=28 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140521152418/http://www.footballaustralia.com.au/wswanderersfc/news-display/Wanderers-Announce-Player-Departures/90596 |archivedate=21 May 2014}}</ref> and was announced to have joined A-League rivals [[Melbourne City FC|Melbourne City]] the same day. He scored his first goal against [[Brisbane Roar]], and also scored in both fixtures against his former club [[Western Sydney Wanderers]]. At the end of the season he claimed [[Melbourne City FC|Melbourne City's]] Player of the Year award and was the club's top scorer that season, also racking up eight assists. Mooy became the youngest ever marquee player in [[A-League]] history when he re-signed with [[Melbourne City FC|Melbourne City]] for the [[2015–16 A-League|2015–16 season]]. On 29 September, he scored a [[hat-trick]] against [[Heidelberg United]] in the [[FFA Cup]] quarter finals with two of the goals coming from outside the box, and in doing this he also became the first ever City player to score a hat-trick in the FFA Cup. During his time with Melbourne City, [[Socceroos]] manager [[Ange Postecoglou]] labelled him the "best and most exciting player in the [[A-League]]", while former Socceroo goalkeeper [[Mark Bosnich]] described him as "the best Australian midfielder playing anywhere in the world".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.footballaustralia.com.au/melbourneheart/news-display/Aaron-Mooy-joins-Melbourne-Heart-FC/90581 |title=Aaron Mooy joins Melbourne Heart FC |date=21 May 2014 |publisher=Melbourne Heart FC |accessdate=28 May 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140521065900/http://www.footballaustralia.com.au/melbourneheart/news-display/Aaron-Mooy-joins-Melbourne-Heart-FC/90581 |archivedate=21 May 2014}}</ref> Melbourne City were reported to have rejected a $2m offer for Mooy from Saudi Arabia club [[Al-Nassr FC|Al-Nassr]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.theage.com.au/sport/soccer/melbourne-city/melbourne-city-reject-record-offer-from-alnassr-for-socceroos-star-aaron-mooy-20151210-glkg2k.html |title=Melbourne City reject record offer from Al-Nassr for Socceroos star Aaron Mooy |first=Dominic |last=Bossi |newspaper=The Age |date=10 December 2015}}</ref> On 5 March 2016, he assisted [[Bruno Fornaroli]] for two of his three goals to move to 20 assists for the season; an all time [[A League|A-League]] record.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.foxsports.com.au/football/a-league/bruno-fornaroli-scores-his-18th-goal-of-the-season-to-give-melbourne-city-lead-over-sydney-fc/news-story/a16d03ebc34d9f20da5b69a10f4ba644 |title=Bruno Fornaroli scores his 18th, 19th and 20th goals of season to give Melbourne City win over Sydney FC |first=Michael |last=Puterflam |publisher=Fox Sports |date=March 2016}}</ref>
===Manchester City/Huddersfield Town=== Mooy was signed by [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on a three-year deal on 30 June 2016.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.melbournecityfc.com.au/article/melbourne-city-fc-player-update/1n1zdb8j3i7f6146kxvdiez250 |title=Melbourne City FC Player Update |publisher=[[Melbourne City FC|Melbourne City]] |date=30 June 2016}}</ref> Six days later, he was loaned to Championship side [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] for the 2016–17 season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.htafc.com/news/article/2016-17/huddersfield-town-aaron-mooy-manchester-city-loan-signing-3169488.aspx |title=Man City's Aaron Mooy arrives at HTAFC |publisher=Huddersfield Town A.F.C. |date=5 July 2016 |accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref> He made his Huddersfield debut in their 2–1 win over [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] on 6 August,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/football/huddersfield-town/huddersfield-town-2-brentford-1-terriers-win-at-john-smith-s-stadium-1-8054717 |title=Huddersfield Town 2 Brentford 1: Terriers win at John Smith's Stadium |first=Leon |last=Wobschall |newspaper=The Yorkshire Post |date=6 August 2016}}</ref> and scored his first goal for them on 10 September in a 1–0 win over [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] in a [[West Yorkshire derby]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/sport/football/match-reports/leeds-united-0-huddersfield-town-11867737 |title=Leeds United 0 Huddersfield Town 1: Aaron Mooy screamer seals best ever Town start |first=Mel |last=Booth |newspaper=Huddersfield Daily Examiner |date=10 September 2016}}</ref> On 28 November 2016 he scored the equaliser in an eventual 2–1 loss at home to Wigan Athletic.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38047433 |title=Huddersfield 1–2 Wigan Athletic |date=28 November 2016 |accessdate=29 November 2015}}</ref> Huddersfield Town fans voted Mooy as the best player of their 2016–17 EFL Championship season. Mooy was involved in the squad that won the Championship Play-off Final, scoring one of Huddersfields's four penalties in the penalty shootout against Reading.
On 15 June 2017, it was reported that Huddersfield had agreed a fee with Manchester City to sign Mooy on a permanent basis. The fee was reported to be £8 million initially, with a potential to rise to £10 million depending on add-ons. Man City would also have a buy-back clause for Mooy.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40289316 |title=Aaron Mooy: Huddersfield Town agree club-record £10m fee with Man City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 June 2017 |accessdate=15 June 2017}}</ref> The transfer was finalised on 30 June.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.htafc.com/news/2017/june/transfer-aaron-mooy-joins-town-permanently/ |title=Huddersfield Town TRANSFER: AARON MOOY JOINS TOWN PERMANENTLY}}</ref>
Mooy made his [[Premier League]] debut for Huddersfield in their first game of the [[2017–18 Premier League|2017–18 season]], a 3–0 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], Mooy himself involved in two of the goals.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://theworldgame.sbs.com.au/article/2017/08/13/mooy-assist-mode-huddersfield-thump-palace |title=Mooy in assist mode as Huddersfield thump Palace |website=The World Game |publisher=SBS |date=13 August 2017 |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref> He scored his first Premier League goal one week later, the only goal of the game as Huddersfield defeated [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40914669 |publisher=BBC Sport |title=Huddersfield Town 1–0 Newcastle United |date=20 August 2017 |accessdate=21 August 2017}}</ref> On 21 October 2017, Mooy scored the opening goal as Huddersfield upset [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] 2–1 in a Premier League clash at [[Kirklees Stadium|John Smith's Stadium]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-10-22/mooy-the-man-as-huddersfield-shock-manchester-united/9074026?section=sport |title=Aaron Mooy scores as Huddersfield shocks Manchester United |publisher=ABC News |date=22 October 2017 |accessdate=22 October 2017}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Cameroon-Australia (21) (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Mooy playing for [[Australia national soccer team|Australia]] in 2017]]
Mooy was eligible to represent [[Germany national football team|Germany]] or the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] through his parents.<ref name="adelaidenow.com.au"/>
Mooy made 10 appearances for the [[Young Socceroos]] between 2008 and 2009 and scored four goals. He played at the [[2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] and played in two group stage games before Australia were eliminated, scoring in his second game against [[Brazil national under-20 football team|Brazil]]. He was called up to the senior [[Socceroos|Australian]] side in August 2009, for a friendly match against the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fai.ie/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=100196:australia-squad-named-for-ireland-friendly&catid=1:senior-men&Itemid=8 |title=Australia squad named for Ireland friendly |publisher=Football Association of Ireland |date=4 August 2009 |accessdate=31 July 2012}}</ref>
In late 2011, Mooy declared his desire to play for [[Australia Olympic football team|Australia]] at the [[2012 Summer Olympics]],<ref>{{cite news |title=St Mirren kid Aaron Mooy: I'd love to be part of Australia's 2012 Olympic squad |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/st-mirren-kid-aaron-mooy-1089810 |newspaper=Daily Record |date=17 December 2011 |accessdate=16 August 2013}}</ref> however, they were unsuccessful in their [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's Asian Qualifiers|qualifying campaign]] for [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|London 2012]].
On 7 December 2012, he made his international debut with the [[Australia national soccer team|Socceroos]] against [[Guam national football team|Guam]] scoring a free-kick to open the scoring in a game the Socceroos would win 9–0.<ref>{{cite news |title=Aaron Mooy scores on Socceroo Debut |url=http://www.westsydneyfootball.com/_/player-articles/aaron-mooy-scores-on-socceroo-debut-r240 |publisher=Western Sydney Football |date=7 December 2012 |accessdate=16 August 2013}}</ref> In the following game against [[Chinese Taipei national football team|Chinese Taipei]], Mooy again scored a free-kick as the Socceroos won 8–0 and qualified for the [[EAFF East Asian Cup]].
On 11 March 2015, Mooy was selected in a squad to play [[Germany national football team|Germany]] and [[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonia]]. On 3 September 2015, he scored the fifth goal in a 5–0 defeat of [[Bangladesh national football team|Bangladesh]] in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification – AFC Second Round|2018 FIFA World Cup qualifier]] in Perth.<ref>{{cite web |title=Australia put five past Bangladesh in second straight WC qualifier as well as another against Jordan later in qualifying. win |url=http://www.espnfc.com/world-cup-qualifying-afc/match/433434/australia-bangladesh/report |publisher=ESPN FC |accessdate=3 September 2015 |date=3 September 2015}}</ref>
He also holds a Dutch passport due to his mother's heritage.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.lntup.com/2017/06/30/huddersfield-town-permanently-sign-aaron-mooy/ |title=Huddersfield Town permanently sign Aaron Mooy |date=30 June 2017|access-date=25 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201054434/https://www.lntup.com/2017/06/30/huddersfield-town-permanently-sign-aaron-mooy/ |archivedate=1 December 2017}}</ref>
In May 2018 he was named in Australia’s 23-man [[Australia national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb |title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad - 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced? - Goal.com |publisher=}}</ref>
