revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=June 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Jason Puncheon | image = Crystal Palace 0 Chelsea 3 (3).jpg | image_size = | caption = Puncheon playing for [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in 2016 | fullname = Jason David Ian Puncheon{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1986|6|18|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Crystal Palace player profiles: Jason Puncheon |url=http://www.cpfc.co.uk/team/player-profile/jason-puncheon/42 |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |accessdate=29 May 2018}} | birth_place = [[Croydon]], England | height = {{convert|1.73|m|order=flip}} | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]]
(on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]) | clubnumber = 42 | years1 = 2003–2004 | clubs1 = [[Wimbledon F.C.|Wimbledon]] | caps1 = 8 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2004–2006 | clubs2 = [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] | caps2 = 26 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2006 | clubs3 = [[Fisher Athletic F.C.|Fisher Athletic]] | caps3 = 1 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2006 | clubs4 = [[Lewes F.C.|Lewes]] | caps4 = 1 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2006–2008 | clubs5 = [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] | caps5 = 78 | goals5 = 15 | years6 = 2008–2010 | clubs6 = [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] | caps6 = 6 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2008 | clubs7 = → [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] (loan) | caps7 = 9 | goals7 = 1 | years8 = 2009 | clubs8 = → [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] (loan) | caps8 = 20 | goals8 = 3 | years9 = 2009–2010 | clubs9 = → [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] (loan) | caps9 = 24 | goals9 = 7 | years10 = 2010–2014 | clubs10 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps10 = 74 | goals10 = 9 | years11 = 2010–2011 | clubs11 = → [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] (loan) | caps11 = 7 | goals11 = 5 | years12 = 2011 | clubs12 = → [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] (loan) | caps12 = 11 | goals12 = 3 | years13 = 2011 | clubs13 = → [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] (loan) | caps13 = 2 | goals13 = 0 | years14 = 2013–2014 | clubs14 = → [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] (loan) | caps14 = 20 | goals14 = 3 | years15 = 2014– | clubs15 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps15 = 133 | goals15 = 12 | years16 = 2019– | clubs16 = → [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] (loan) | caps16 = 4 | goals16 = 0 | club-update = 19:05, 11 February 2019 (UTC) }} '''Jason David Ian Puncheon''' (born 18 June 1986) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]], on loan from [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]]. Following his goal against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on his [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] debut, he has scored in all of the top four divisions of English league football, scoring for [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] in [[EFL League Two|League Two]], [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] and [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in [[EFL League One|League One]], [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] in the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] and Blackpool, Southampton and Crystal Palace in the Premier League. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Croydon]], Greater London, Puncheon began his career with [[Wimbledon F.C.|Wimbledon]], and moved [[Relocation of Wimbledon F.C. to Milton Keynes|with the team]] to Milton Keynes, where the club became [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in 2004. He was released in January 2006. He moved to [[Barnet F.C.|Barnet]] in June of the same year, after brief spells with [[Fisher Athletic F.C.|Fisher Athletic]] and [[Lewes F.C.|Lewes]].{{cite book |last=Hugman |first=Barry |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2007–08 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |year=2007 |isbn=978-1-84596-246-3 |page=332}} He was named [[FA Cup]] Player of the Third Round in 2007 and the following season after scoring a succession of brilliant goals (including a last minute 35-yard free kick versus Bradford) was named in the PFA Team of the Season.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/fa_cup/6271595.stm |title=Puncheon nets FA Cup player award |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2007 |accessdate=5 January 2010}} ===Plymouth Argyle=== [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]] signed Puncheon from Barnet for £250,000 in 2008. He endured an unsuccessful 18-month spell at the club, making six league appearances. He was loaned to former club MK Dons three times in two years, where he scored 11 goals in 51 appearances. ===Southampton=== On 30 January 2010, Puncheon joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] which then led to his loan deal at MK Dons to be cut short.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~1949524,00.html |title=Puncheon joins Saints |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=30 January 2010 |accessdate=30 January 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100201051858/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10280~1949524%2C00.html |archivedate=1 February 2010 |df=dmy-all}} He scored his first goal in a 5–1 victory over Walsall, and scored again a few days later, in a 5–0 victory over Huddersfield. At the start of the 2010–11 season, he was a regular in the first team. However, when [[Alan Pardew]] lost his job just days after a 4–0 win away to [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]], Southampton hired [[Nigel Adkins]] as manager. Under Adkins, he stayed in the first team, but found himself under increasing pressure from [[Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain]] for his place. Eventually Adkins lost patience with Puncheon's erratic performances, and dropped him to the bench in favour of 17-year-old Chamberlain, who was later sold to Arsenal for a reported £15m. On 16 November 2010, Puncheon moved on an emergency loan deal to [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]].{{cite web |title=Jason To Join Lions |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~2222518,00.html |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=17 November 2010 |date=16 November 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101119000200/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10280~2222518%2C00.html |archivedate=19 November 2010 |df=}} He scored his first goal on his first game for Millwall in their 1–0 victory over [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].{{cite news |title=Middlesbrough 0–1 Millwall |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/9194875.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=5 December 2010 |date=20 November 2010}} On 1 January 2011, Puncheon scored a [[hat-trick]] in the 3–0 victory over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].{{cite news |title=Millwall 3–0 Crystal Palace |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/9322923.stm |accessdate=1 January 2011 |date=1 January 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport}} On 31 January 2011, Puncheon joined [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite news |title=Holloway pounces for Puncheon |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12875_6715303,00.html |accessdate=31 January 2011 |date=31 January 2011 |publisher=Sky Sports}} He made his debut, scoring a goal, at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] on 5 February.{{cite news |last=Phillips |first=Owen |title=Everton 5–3 Blackpool |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/9384152.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=6 February 2011 |date=5 February 2011}} He scored his second goal against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] on 7 March at [[Bloomfield Road]]. Puncheon re-joined the Saints after Blackpool's failed attempt to fight off relegation.{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/9043848.Relegated_Puncheon_back_with_Saints/ |title=Relegated Puncheon back with Saints |newspaper=Daily Echo |date=24 May 2011 |accessdate=24 May 2011}} On 31 August 2011, Puncheon joined [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on loan until 2 January 2012.{{cite web |title=Punch Off |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~2438739,00.html |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=1 September 2011 |date=1 September 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120919222655/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10280~2438739%2C00.html |archivedate=19 September 2012 |df=dmy-all}}{{cite news |title=QPR sign Southampton forward Jason Puncheon on loan |publisher=BBC Sport |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14752434.stm |accessdate=10 September 2011 |date=1 September 2011}} He returned to the Saints after his unsuccessful loan spell at QPR,{{cite news |first=Nabil |last=Hassan |title=Southampton do not want to keep Jason Puncheon, says agent |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16490298 |newspaper=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 February 2012 |date=10 January 2012}} but on 21 January 2012, he publicly criticised Executive chairman [[Nicola Cortese]].{{cite news |title=Jason Puncheon criticises Southampton chairman Nicola Cortese |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16678939.stm |newspaper=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 January 2012 |date=23 January 2011}} However just days later, it was revealed that Puncheon had apologised to Cortese and would be available for selection in the first team.{{cite news |title=Jason Puncheon settles Twitter row with Southampton. chairman |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16726108.stm |newspaper=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 February 2012 |date=25 January 2012}} He then started the next two matches: a 1–1 draw in the [[FA Cup]] at [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]]{{cite web |title=Millwall vs Southampton |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10280~61469,00.html |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=3 February 2012 |date=28 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120131184229/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10280~61469%2C00.html |archivedate=31 January 2012 |df=dmy-all}} and a 1–1 draw in the Championship against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]].{{cite web |title=Southampton vs Cardiff City |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10280~59503,00.html |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=3 February 2012 |date=31 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120202031405/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10280~59503%2C00.html |archivedate=2 February 2012 |df=dmy-all}} He scored his first goal of the 2012–13 season with a 30-yard volley in a league cup win at [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]]. He scored his first Premier League goal for Southampton in a 4–1 home victory against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]. His second came when Southampton won 3–1 away to Queens Park Rangers. He scored his third Premier League goal in the 61st minute against [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] to secure Southampton a vital 1–0 victory and move them out of the relegation zone. His fourth was scored to give [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] a 2–2 draw away to the Champions of Europe [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. On 9 February 2013, he scored his fifth in [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton's]] 3–1 home win against 2011–12 champions [[Manchester City]]. On 1 March 2013, Puncheon signed a new contract with Southampton, expiring in 2016.{{cite news |title=Jason Puncheon signs new contract at Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21637252 |newspaper=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 March 2013 |date=1 March 2013}} ===Crystal Palace=== On 21 August 2013, Puncheon signed a one-year loan with [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].{{cite news |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2013/august/palace-sign-puncheon-on-loan/ |title=Palace sign Puncheon on loan |date=21 August 2013 |accessdate=21 August 2013 |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C.}} He missed a penalty as Palace lost 2–0 away to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 11 January 2014,{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25600519 |title=Tottenham 2–0 Crystal Palace |first=Timothy |last=Abraham |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 January 2014 |accessdate=17 May 2014}} but made up for his miss by scoring the only goal of their 1–0 win against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] the following weekend.{{cite news |last=Chase |first=Graham |title=Crystal Palace 1–0 Stoke |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25693671 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 May 2014 |date=18 January 2014}} On 31 January 2014, Puncheon made his loan spell into a permanent move, for a fee of around £1.75m.{{Cite web |title=Puncheon pens permanent deal |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2014/january/puncheon-pens-permanent-deal/ |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |date=31 January 2014}} Puncheon's three goals in January and a further three in back-to-back wins in April that lifted Palace away from the relegation zone, led boss Tony Pulis to issue a 'hands off' warning to other clubs interesting in signing Puncheon.{{cite news |title=Jason Puncheon is not going anywhere warns Crystal Palace boss Pulis |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/jason-puncheon-is-not-going-anywhere-warns-crystal-palace-boss-pulis-9250768.html |newspaper=London Evening Standard |accessdate=14 April 2014 |date=10 April 2014}} On 16 August 2014, in Palace's first match of the new season away to [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], Puncheon took a corner which was headed in by [[Brede Hangeland]] for the first goal of the game. He was sent off for his second booking in the 89th minute, after which Arsenal scored their winning goal.{{cite news |last1=Chowdhury |first1=Saj |title=Arsenal 2–1 Crystal Palace |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28718788 |accessdate=16 August 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 August 2014}} On 17 January 2015, Puncheon scored his third goal of the season and second in as many games against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in a 3–2 away win. Crystal Palace had come from 2 goals down to claim victory to boost their survival hopes. Palace manager [[Alan Pardew]] heaped praise on Puncheon's performance, describing him as "the best player on the pitch by a country mile."{{cite news |last1=McMath |first1=James |title=Burnley 2–3 Crystal Palace |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/30758390 |accessdate=18 January 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2015}} On 6 April 2015, Puncheon scored the winning goal for Crystal Palace against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. Puncheon's goal came from a freekick which went past Manchester City's goalkeeper [[Joe Hart]].{{Cite news |url=https://lockerdome.com/6556955711900993/7565437722568724 |title=Jason Puncheon free kick helps Crystal Palace defeat Man City |date=6 April 2015 |website=LockerDome|access-date=3 April 2017 |language=en-US}} He opened the scoring in the [[2016 FA Cup Final]] against Manchester United with a goal in the 78th minute, but Palace went on to lose the match 2–1 after extra time.{{cite news |last1=Taylor |first1=Daniel |title=Manchester United win FA Cup as Jesse Lingard sinks Crystal Palace |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/may/21/crystal-palace-manchester-united-fa-cup-final-match-report |accessdate=4 February 2018 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=21 May 2016}} On 18 July 2017, Puncheon replaced [[Scott Dann]] as captain.{{cite web |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2017/july/puncheon-confirmed-as-palace-captain/ |title=Puncheon confirmed as Palace captain |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |date=18 July 2017 |accessdate=21 November 2017}} In January 2018, manager [[Roy Hodgson]] announced that Puncheon would play no further part in the [[2017–18 Crystal Palace F.C. season|2017–18 season]] following a [[cruciate ligament]] injury sustained while playing against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite news |title=Scott Dann and Jason Puncheon: Crystal Palace duo out for rest of season |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 January 2018 |accessdate=3 January 2018 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42548138}} ===Huddersfield Town=== On 4 January 2019, Puncheon signed for Premier League club [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46764967 |title=Jason Puncheon: Huddersfield sign Crystal Palace winger on loan for rest of season |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 January 2019 |accessdate=4 January 2019}} ==Personal life== Puncheon is of Jamaican descent and is eligible for the [[Jamaica national football team]].{{cite news |last1=Collomosse |first1=Tom |title=Jamaica hoping to poach Liverpool's Andre Wisdom, Tottenham's Danny Rose and Crystal Palace's Jason Puncheon for Copa America |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/jamaica-hoping-to-poach-liverpools-andre-wisdom-tottenhams-danny-rose-and-crystal-palaces-jason-10097836.html |accessdate=19 December 2017 |newspaper=The Independent |date=10 March 2015}} In December 2017, Puncheon was arrested and charged with possession of an offensive weapon, common assault, and a public order offence of "causing fear or provocation of violence" after a fight outside a nightclub in [[Reigate]].{{cite news |last1=Aarons |first1=Ed |title=Crystal Palace's Jason Puncheon charged with assault and possession of weapon |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/dec/18/jason-puncheon-crystal-palace-assault-arrested |accessdate=19 December 2017 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=18 December 2017}}{{cite news |title=Crystal Palace's Jason Puncheon on weapon charge |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-surrey-42392660 |publisher=BBC News |accessdate=19 December 2017 |date=18 December 2017}} On 5 January 2018, Puncheon appeared in court where he denied the charge of assault. The charge of possessing an offensive weapon was withdrawn and he was bailed to appear again in court on 4 June.{{cite news |title=Crystal Palace footballer Jason Puncheon denies assault |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-surrey-42579835 |accessdate=5 January 2018 |publisher=BBC News |date=4 February 2018}} He later changed his plea to guilty and was given a community order requiring him to carry out 210 hours of unpaid work, and pay the doorman involved £250 compensation.{{cite news |title=Crystal Palace's Jason Puncheon admits bouncer belt attack |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-surrey-44356512 |publisher=BBC News |accessdate=4 June 2018 |date=4 June 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 9 February 2019}}{{soccerbase season|38041|2004|accessdate=22 January 2019}}{{cite web |url=http://soccerfactsuk.co.uk/s2005/player_details.php?playerid=5782 |title=Player details: Season 2005–2006: Jason Puncheon football team|Egypt]] | nationalcaps4 = 28 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | ntupdate = 17:32, 25 June 2018 (UTC) }} '''Ramadan Sobhi Ahmed''' ({{lang-arz|رمضان صبحي|translit=Ramaḍān Subḥī}}; born 23 January 1997) is an Egyptian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Winger|winger]] for [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]] on loan from [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] and the [[Egypt national football team|Egypt national team]].
Sobhi began his career with leading Egyptian club [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]], making his professional debut in February 2014. He established himself in the first team at the [[Cairo International Stadium]] and helped Al Ahly to win the [[Egyptian Premier League]] title in the [[2013–14 Egyptian Premier League|2013–14]] and [[2015–16 Egyptian Premier League|2015–16]] campaigns. His performances attracted the attentions of European clubs and in July 2016 he joined English side [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] for a fee of £5 million. He spent two seasons with Stoke before joining [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] in June 2018. On 28 December 2018, it was announced that Ramadan Sobhi returned to [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]] on loan from [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield]] for 6 months for a fee of £800,000 after failing to make appearances for The Terriers, with just 3 appearances out of the bench.
==Club career== ===Al Ahly=== After progressing through the youth ranks at [[Cairo]] club [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]], Sobhi made his professional debut at the age of 16 on 6 February 2014, in a [[2013–14 Egyptian Premier League]] match against [[Ghazl El Mahalla SC|Ghazl El Mahalla]] under the management of [[Mohamed Youssef (football)|Mohamed Youssef]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Individual Highlights: 16-year-old Ramadan Sobhy's first official match with Al Ahly|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2014/02/07/individiual-highlights-16-year-old-ramadan-sobhys-first-official-match-al-ahly/|website=King Fut|accessdate=10 July 2016}}</ref> In April 2014 he took part in the Sheikh Zayed friendly tournament in the [[UAE]] with Al Ahly-U17's, and attracted the attentions of Spanish club [[Atlético Madrid]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ramadan Sobhy among three Al Ahly youth players Atlético Madrid show interest in|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2014/04/25/atletico-madrid-ahly-youth-players/|website=King Fut|accessdate=10 July 2016}}</ref> On 16 June 2014, he scored his first goal for Al Ahly in a 3–0 win over [[Misr Lel-Makkasa SC|Misr Lel-Makkasa]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ramadan Sobhy shines as Al Ahly cruise past Misr El-Maqassa|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2014/06/16/ramadan-sobhy-shines-al-ahly-cruise-past-misr-el-maqassa/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> On 28 June 2014 he started the decisive championship play-off match against [[Cairo derby|city rivals]], [[Zamalek SC|Zamalek]] and helped his team to a 1–0 victory.<ref>{{cite web|title=Al Ahly overcome Zamalek in 108th league Cairo derby|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2014/06/29/al-ahly-overcome-zamalek-in-cairo-derby/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> On 2 July he scored twice against [[Petrojet FC|Petrojet]] to secure a 4–0 win and Al Ahly went on to claim the league title.<ref>{{cite web|title=Four-star Al Ahly cruise past Petrojet|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2014/07/03/four-star-al-ahly-cruise-past-petrojet/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Al Ahly win unprecedented 37th league title following Smouha stalemate|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2014/07/08/al-ahly-win-unprecedented-37th-league-title/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> In March 2015, Sobhi signed a long-term contract with Al Ahly.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ramadan Sobhy signs new 5-year contract with Al Ahly|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2015/03/04/ramadan-sobhy-signs-a-new-contract-with-al-ahly-2/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Al Ahly extend contracts of 8 players|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2014/11/03/ahly-extends-contracts-8-players-until-2020/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref>
Sobhi helped Al Ahly win the [[2014 Egyptian Super Cup]] against Zamalek.<ref>{{cite web|title=Al Ahly beat Zamalek to win Egypt Super Cup|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2014/09/14/al-ahly-beat-zamalek-win-egypt-super-cup/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> He became a regular under [[Juan Carlos Garrido|Juan Garrido]] and his performances in [[2014–15 Egyptian Premier League|2014–15]] attracted the attentions of European clubs, including [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], [[RB Leipzig]], [[A.S. Roma|Roma]], [[U.C. Sampdoria|Sampdoria]] and [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Al Ahly receive Arsenal trial offer for Ramadan Sobhy: Wael Reyad|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2015/02/02/al-ahly-arsenal-trial-ramadan-sobhy/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Al Ahly youngster Ramadan Sobhy on RB Leipzig's radar – Report|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2014/12/16/sobhy-reportedly-rb-leipzigs-radar/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Sampdoria bid for Al Ahly's Ramadan Sobhy|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2015/03/31/sampdoria-bid-ramadan-sobhy/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Udinese interested in Al Ahly duo Sobhy, Trezeguet|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2015/03/25/udinese-interested-al-ahly-sobhy-trezeguet/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=AS Roma send official offer for Ramadan Sobhy|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2015/06/23/as-roma-sends-official-offer-for-ramadan-sobhy/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> He scored a late equalizer against [[Al-Masry SC|Al-Masry]] on 10 January 2015, in what was the first meeting between the clubs since the 2012 [[Port Said Stadium riot]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Sobhy salvages late point for Al Ahly against Al Masry|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2015/01/10/sobhy-salvages-late-point-al-ahly-al-masry/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> Sobhi attracted international attention after he stood on the ball in a 2–0 win against Zamalek on 21 July 2015, which caused [[Hazem Emam (footballer, born 1988)|Hazem Emam]] to kick out at Sobhi and was sent off.<ref>{{cite web|title=Football – Al Ahly midfielder Ramadan Sobhi gets player sent off after standing on the ball|url=https://uk.sports.yahoo.com/news/football-ah-ahly-midfielder-ramadan-sobhi-gets-player-112939546--sow.html|website=Yahoo|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> Al Ahly ended the 2014–15 campaign in second place behind their arch rivals Zamalek.<ref>{{cite web|title=Al Ahly down Al Masry 2–0 to secure second place|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2015/07/06/al-ahly-defeat-al-masry/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref>
Sobhi caused controversy in the [[2015 Egyptian Super Cup]] against Zamalek as he repeated his stand on the ball trick which enraged the Zamalek players.<ref>{{cite web|title=Tempers flair as Al Ahly defeat Zamalek in Abu Dhabi to win Super Cup|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2015/10/15/tempers-flair-as-al-ahly-defeat-zamalek-in-abu-dhabi-to-win-super-cup/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> Al Ahly went on to win the match 3–2 and he later apologized for his showboating.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ramadan Sobhy apologises for showboating|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2015/10/19/ramadan-sobhy-apologises-for-showboating/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> He was sent off for the first time in his career on 15 April 2016 in a match against [[ENPPI Club|ENPPI]], for an argument with an ENNPI player at half time.<ref>{{cite web|title=10-man Al Ahly beat ENPPI to widen gap with Zamalek|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2016/04/15/al-ahly-vs-enppi/|website=King Fut|accessdate=13 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Martin Jol: Ramadan's sending off really bothered me|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2016/04/16/martin-jol-ramadans-sending-off-really-bothered-me/|website=King Fut|accessdate=13 July 2016}}</ref> Sobhi played in 28 league matches for Al Ahly in [[2015–16 Egyptian Premier League|2015–16]] under [[Martin Jol]] as the side claimed another league title.<ref>{{cite web|title=Al Ahly secure 38th league title after beating Ismaily|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2016/06/25/ahly-secure-league-title/|website=King Fut|accessdate=13 July 2016}}</ref>
===Stoke City=== Sobhi signed for [[Premier League]] club [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] on 25 July 2016 for a fee of £5 million.<ref>{{cite web|title=Potters Seal Sobhi Swoop|url=http://www.stokecityfc.com/news/article/2016-17/potters-seal-sobhi-swoop-3205294.aspx|website=Stoke City|accessdate=25 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Ramadan Sobhi: Stoke sign Egyptian winger from Al Ahly|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36885225|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=25 July 2016}}</ref> He made his Premier League debut for Stoke on 20 August 2016 against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 1–4 Man City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37067875|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 August 2016}}</ref> He made his first assist for Stoke on 31 October 2016 in a 3–1 win against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] as his cross was deflected in by [[Alfie Mawson]] for an [[own goal]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Mark Hughes knew the time was right to turn to Ramadan Sobhi|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/stoke-city-mark-hughes-knew-the-time-was-right-to-turn-to-ramadan-sobhi/story-29860906-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=27 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 3–1 Swansea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37290829|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=27 February 2017}}</ref> He made his first Premier League start in the next match against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]], becoming the first teenager to start a league game for Stoke in nine years.<ref>{{cite web|title=West Ham v Stoke: Ramadan Sobhi bidding to be first teenage league starter in nine years|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/west-ham-v-stoke-ramadan-sobhi-bidding-to-be-first-teenage-league-starter-in-nine-years/story-29868831-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=24 May 2017}}</ref> After returning from the [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations]], Sobhi impressed in home wins over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] and [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke goal hero Joe Allen heaps praise on Ramadan Sobhi|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/stoke-goal-hero-joe-allen-heaps-praise-on-ramadan-sobhi/story-30130734-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=24 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 2 Middlesbrough 0 TALKING POINT: Ramadan Sobhi has the cocktail to be Boothen End favourite|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/stoke-2-middlesbrough-0-talking-point-ramadan-sobhi-has-the-cocktail-to-be-boothen-end-favourite/story-30180725-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=24 May 2017}}</ref> Sobhi played 19 times in [[2016–17 Stoke City F.C. season|2016–17]], as Stoke finished in 13th position.<ref name="2016/17"/><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 2016/17 Premier League season review|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11701/10887143/stoke-201617-premier-league-season-review|website=Sky Sports|accessdate=22 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke's Ramadan Sobhi: 'It was not arrogance, it was just a bit of skill'|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/may/20/stoke-ramadan-sobhi-egypt-premier-leagueal-ahly|website=The Guardian|accessdate=24 May 2017}}</ref>
Prior to the start of the [[2017–18 Stoke City F.C. season|2017–18]] season, Sobhi signed a new five-year contract with the Potters.<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke City hand long-term contract to Ramadan Sobhi|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/stoke-city-hand-long-term-contract-to-ramadan-sobhi/story-30477578-detail/story.html|website=Stoke Sentinel|accessdate=10 August 2017}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Stoke on 23 August 2017 in a 4–0 [[EFL Cup]] win over [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ramadan Sobhi scores first Stoke goal as Potters progress in EFL Cup|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2017/08/24/ramadan-scores-stoke-city/|website=Kingfut|accessdate=24 August 2017}}</ref> He scored his first Premier League goal on 23 December 2017, in a 3–1 win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Stoke 3–1 West Brom|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42375901|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=23 December 2017}}</ref> He followed this up with a goal against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] in a 1–1 on boxing day.<ref>{{cite web|title=Huddersfield 1-1 Stoke|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42360025|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=21 May 2018}}</ref> Sobhi made 27 appearances in 2017–18 as Stoke suffered relegation to the [[EFL Championship]].<ref name="2017/18"/>
===Huddersfield Town=== Sobhi joined [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on 12 June 2018, signing a three-year deal for a fee of £5.7 million.<ref>{{cite web |title=Ramadan Sobhi: Huddersfield Town sign Stoke City winger for £5.7m |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44459503 |website=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 June 2018}}</ref>
===Return to Al Ahly=== On 28 December 2018 Sobhi came back to his old club [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]] as a loan from [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield]] for 6 months for a fee of £800,000.<ref>{{cite web |title=Ramadan Sobhi: Al Ahly sign Huddersfield winger for £800k as a loan for 6 months |url=https://www.filgoal.com/articles/353687|website=FilGoal |accessdate=28 December 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Sobhi made his national team debut against [[Tanzania national football team|Tanzania]] on 14 June 2015 in the first round of [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations qualification|2017 Africa Cup of Nations qualifier]] at the age of 17 years, 11 months and 18 days, to become the second youngest player to ever play for the Egyptian national team after [[Mido (footballer)|Mido]]. On 29 March he scored his first international goal on top level, in a [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations qualification]] game against [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]].<ref name="Nigeria"/> In January Sobhi was selected by [[Héctor Cúper]] in the [[Egypt national football team|Egyptian]] squad that competed in the [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations]]. Sobhi was mainly used as a substitute in the competition, featuring in four games out of the six as Egypt lost in the [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations Final|final]] to [[Cameroon national football team|Cameroon]].<ref name="AFCON2017">{{cite web|title=Egypt 1–2 Cameroon|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38786537|website=BBC Sport|accessdate=8 February 2017}}</ref> In May 2018 he was named in Egypt's preliminary [[Egypt national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{cite web|title= World Cup 2018: All the confirmed squads for this summer's finals in Russia|url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/440833652018}}</ref>
==Style of play== Sobhi is mostly used upfront on either wings, although he also can be used as an attacking midfielder or a secondary striker.<ref name="FIFA">{{cite web|title=A new prodigy rises in Egypt|url=https://www.fifa.com/live-scores/news/y=2016/m=6/news=a-new-prodigy-rises-in-egypt-2801871.html|website=FIFA|accessdate=5 July 2016}}</ref> His style of play, which combines dribbling, clinical passing, vision, and an eye for goal, made him dubbed on several occasions as the new [[Mohamed Aboutrika]], who is considered to be one of Egypt's greatest footballers.<ref name="FIFA"/>
==Personal life== Speaking in February 2016, Sobhi stated that he supports Spanish side [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ramadan Sobhy: I support Real Madrid|url=http://www.kingfut.com/2016/02/26/ramadan-sobhy/|website=King Fut|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> He is married to Habiba Ekramy, sister of [[Al Ahly SC|Ahly]] ex-teammate and national teammate [[Sherif Ekramy]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Ramadan Sobhy is engaged to sister of Sherif Ekramy|url=http://en.el-balad.com/2296782|website=Sada Elbalad|accessdate=8 February 2017}}</ref>

nationalcaps3 = 6 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | club-update = 22:00, 13 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Rajiv Ramon van La Parra''' (born 4 June 1991) is a Dutch professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Football League Championship]] club [[Middlesbrough F.C|Middlesbrough]] on loan from [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]], predominantly as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] but also as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]]. He has also represented [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]].
Van La Parra played his first senior games in France with [[Stade Malherbe Caen|Caen]] before returning to the Netherlands in 2011 for a three-season-long stay with [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]]. In June 2014, he moved to England to join [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]], who loaned him to [[Brighton & Hove Albion]] and [[Huddersfield Town]] before he joined the latter in 2016.
==Club career== ===Caen=== [[File:Rajiv-van-la-para.jpg|thumb|right|Van La Parra training with [[SM Caen|Caen]] in 2010.]] Van La Parra is a product of the [[Feyenoord]] youth system, but made his senior debut instead for [[Ligue 1|French Ligue 1]] club [[Stade Malherbe Caen|Caen]] on 8 November 2008, having agreed a four-year contract in June 2008.<ref name="Caen">{{cite web|url=http://www.caen.maville.com/actu/actudet_-Football-Van-La-Parra-atout-jeune-et-orange-a-Caen-_spo-650285_actu.Htm|title=Van La Parra atout jeune et orange a Caen|language=French|publisher=Caen.maville.com |date=20 June 2008}}</ref> He cited the potential to reach the highest level while playing in France as the reason for his transfer.<ref name="Caen"/>
The right winger made only two appearances for Caen's first team during his first season, and the club ended the campaign being relegated. Despite this relegation, Van La Parra would make only a further eight appearances as the team won promotion back to the top flight, but did register his first senior goal; against [[En Avant de Guingamp|Guingamp]] on 5 April 2009.<ref name="Footnational">{{cite web|url=http://www.foot-national.com/36-3370-81-saison-football-Van-La-Parra-Rajiv.html |title=Van La Parra |language=French|publisher=foot-national.com}}</ref> During these seasons, he instead gained playing time in Caen's second team that competed in the [[Championnat de France amateur]].<ref name="Footnational"/>
===Heerenveen=== In summer 2011, his contract was terminated and he returned to the Netherlands in search of a new club. After an unsuccessful trial at [[AZ Alkmaar]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fanvanaz.nl/archives/3825|title=Rajiv de la Parra week op proef bij AZ|language=Dutch|publisher=fanvanaz.nl|date=4 July 2011}}</ref> he eventually signed a one-year contract with fellow Eredivisie side [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]] on 30 August 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sc-heerenveen.nl/nieuws/sc-heerenveen-contracteert-van-la-parra/10|title=sc Heerenveen contracteert Van La Parra|language=Dutch|publisher=SC Heerenveen |date=30 August 2011}}</ref> After scoring six times during 26 appearances in his debut season, Heerenveen elected to take up an option in his contract for two further seasons.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sc-heerenveen.nl/nieuws/sc-heerenveen-legt-rajiv-van-la-parra-langer-vast/10|title=sc Heerenveen legt Rajiv van La Parra langer vast|language=Dutch|publisher=SC Heerenveen |date=27 March 2012}}</ref> Over these three seasons, Van La Parra made 94 appearances (including playing in the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]]), scoring 16 times.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vi.nl/spelers/carriere/rajiv-van-la-parra.htm|title=Rajiv van La Parra |language=Dutch|publisher=Voetbal International}}</ref>
===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== His contract from Heerenveen expired in the summer of 2014, and after rejecting a new contract,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vi.nl/nieuws/van-la-parra-kan-verlengen-kum-moet-vertrekken-.htm|title=Van La Parra kan verlengen, Kum moet vertrekken|language=Dutch |publisher=SC Heerenveen |date=23 April 2014}}</ref> on 10 June it was announced that he would move to [[Football League Championship|English Championship]] side [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]], with whom he had signed a three-year contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27782113|title=Wolves sign Heerenveen winger Rajiv van La Parra|publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 June 2014}}</ref> He made his debut in the first match on 10 August 2014 against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]], and was named [[man of the match]]. He scored his first goal for Wolves against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in the [[FA Cup]] on 13 January 2015.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30691987|title=Wolves 3–3 Fulham|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=13 January 2015|accessdate=29 August 2016}}</ref> His first league goal came against future club [[Brighton & Hove Albion]] in a 1–1 draw on 14 March 2015.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/31776093|title=Brighton 1–1 Wolves|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=14 March 2015|accessdate=29 August 2016}}</ref>
On 26 November 2015, Van La Parra signed a loan deal with Brighton, lasting until 2 January 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34938160|title=Man Utd's Wilson & Wolves' Van La Parra join Brighton on loan|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 November 2015}}</ref>
===Huddersfield Town=== On 11 March 2016, after some speculation, Van La Parra signed on loan for fellow Championship side [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] for the rest of the season, with the move becoming a permanent deal in the summer, on a three-year contract. He made his debut for the Terriers in the 4–1 [[West Yorkshire derby]] win against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] at [[Elland Road]] on 19 March, and scored his first goal in their 1–0 win over his former club Wolves at the [[Kirklees Stadium]] on 27 August.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37138712|title=Huddersfield 1–0 Wolves|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=27 August 2016|accessdate=29 August 2016}}</ref>
==Personal life== His first name Rajiv is a tribute to former [[Prime Minister of India|Indian Prime Minister]] [[Rajiv Gandhi]], the son of former prime minister [[Indira Gandhi]], assassinated in May 1991.<ref name="Caen"/> One of his half-brothers, [[Georginio Wijnaldum]], currently plays for [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], while another, [[Giliano Wijnaldum]], plays for [[Sparta Rotterdam]]. His cousin, [[Giovanni Drenthe]], is also a professional footballer,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/spotlight-on-georginio-wijnaldum-newcastles-new-dutch-delight/|title=Spotlight on Georginio Wijnaldum: Newcastle's new Dutch delight – Football Oranje|date=12 July 2015}}</ref> while another, [[Royston Drenthe]], came out of retirement and now plays for [[Sparta Rotterdam]].

club-update = 18:00, 16 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Collin Quaner''' (born 18 June 1991) is a German [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]], on loan from [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]].{{cite web | url = http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/3liga/vereine/3-liga/2011-12/vereinslos-0/64228/spieler_quaner-collin.html | title = Quaner, Collin | language = German | publisher = kicker.de | accessdate = 9 January 2012}} == Background == He grew up in [[Düsseldorf-Gerresheim]], where his parents still live.{{cite web|url=http://www.express.de/fortuna-duesseldorf/freitag-zu-gast-in-seiner-heimat-jubelt-collin-quaner-bald-wieder-fuer-fortuna-duesseldorf-,3292,30645682.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150509194244/http://www.express.de/fortuna-duesseldorf/freitag-zu-gast-in-seiner-heimat-jubelt-collin-quaner-bald-wieder-fuer-fortuna-duesseldorf-%2C3292%2C30645682.html/|archive-date=9 Düsseldorf?|language=German|date=8 May 2015|publisher=express.de|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} He is of [[Ghanaian people|Ghanaian]] ancestry.{{cite web|url=http://www.wz-newsline.de/lokales/duesseldorf/sport/fortuna-duesseldorf/collin-quaner-will-sich-in-bielefeld-aufdraengen-1.169810|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150518203153/http://www.wz-newsline.de/lokales/duesseldorf/sport/fortuna-duesseldorf/collin-quaner-will-sich-in-bielefeld-aufdraengen-1.169810|archive-date=18 father ist Ghanian, his mother is German.[https://www.goal.com/en-gh/news/german-born-quaner-excited-about-prospects-of-representing/15er3vgpjg93s12z8rcwsw4rdp] ==Club career== === Union Berlin === In July 2015, after Aalen were relegated to the [[3. Liga]], Quaner moved on a free transfer to 2. Bundesliga side [[1. FC Union Berlin|Union Berlin]] signing a two-year contract until 2017. === Huddersfield Town === On 20 January 2017 he completed a move to [[EFL Championship]] club [[Huddersfield Town]] for an undisclosed fee, signing a three-and-a-half year contract.{{cite web|url=https://www.fc-union-berlin.de/profis/aktuelle-meldungen/detail/1-FC-Union-Berlin-nimmt-Collin-Quaner-unter-Vertrag-18184V/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150526151610/http://www.fc-union-berlin.de/profis/aktuelle-meldungen/detail/1-FC-Union-Berlin-nimmt-Collin-Quaner-unter-Vertrag-18184V/|archive-date=26 May 2015|title= 1. FC Union Berlin nimmt Collin Quaner unter Vertrag |trans-title=1. FC Union Berlin signs Collin Quaner|language=German|date=26 May 2015|publisher=1. FC Union Berlin}} Quaner scored his first goal for the club on his debut against [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] in the [[FA Cup]] on 28 January 2017.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38700789|title=Rochdale 0-4 Huddersfield |publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=28 January 2017|accessdate=29 January 2017}} ==== Ipswich Town (loan) ==== On 8 January 2019, Quaner was loaned to [[Ipswich Town|Ipswich Town]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/amp/football/46804431|title=Collin Quaner: Huddersfield forward joins Ipswich Town on loan|date=2019-01-08|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2019-01-08|language=en-GB}} ==Career statistics== {{updated| 22 March 2019}}{{cite web|title=C. {{Use British English|date=February 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2017}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Rekeil Pyke |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Rekeil Leshaun Pyke{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=11 February 2018}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|9|1|df=y}}{{soccerbase|93704|name=Rekeil Pyke}} |birth_place = [[Leeds]], England |height = {{convert|1.78|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=http://www.footballsquads.co.uk/eng/2016-2017/fltwo/colches.htm |title=Colchester United |publisher=FootballSquads |accessdate=15 February 2017 }} |position = [[Forward (association football)|Forward]] |currentclub = [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]]
(on loan from [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]]) |clubnumber = 30 |youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2009 |youthclubs1 = Rothwell Juniors |youthyears2 = 2009–2016 |youthclubs2 = [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] |years1 = 2016– |clubs1 = [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] |caps1 = 0 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2016 |clubs2 = → [[Wrexham A.F.C.|Wrexham]] (loan) |caps2 = 3 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2017 |clubs3 = → [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]] (loan) |caps3 = 12 |goals3 = 0 |years4 = 2017–2018 |clubs4 = → [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] (loan) |caps4 = 7 |goals4 = 0 |years5 = 2018–2019 |clubs5 = → [[Wrexham A.F.C.|Wrexham]] (loan) |caps5 = 23 |goals5 = 5 |years6 = 2019– |clubs6 = → [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] (loan) |caps6 = 0 |goals6 = 0 |club-update = 20:39, 30 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Rekeil Leshaun Pyke''' (born 1 September 1997) is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for [[EFL League One]] side [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]]. A product of the Huddersfield Town [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C. Reserves and Academy|Academy]], he was loaned out to [[Wrexham A.F.C.|Wrexham]] in November 2016, [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]] in January 2017, and [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] in July 2017. He returned to Wrexham on loan for the first half of the 2018–19 season, before moving on loan to Rochdale for the second half of the campaign. ==Career== ===Huddersfield Town=== Born in [[Leeds]], Pyke is a product of the [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C. Reserves and Academy|Academy]].{{cite news |last=Griffiths |first=Rob |date=1 December 2016 |title=Rekeil Pyke on his Wrexham AFC debut and why he signed for club |url=http://www.dailypost.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/rekeil-pyke-wrexham-afc-debut-12259838 |newspaper=Daily Post |location=Conwy |accessdate=15 February 2017 }} He first joined the club at under-12 level from local junior side Rothwell Juniors.{{cite web |url=http://www.htafc.com/news/article/2016-17/huddersfield-town-rekeil-pyke-wrexham-loan-terriers-3488906.aspx |title=Loan: Rekeil Pyke returns to HTAFC |last=Threlfall-Sykes |first=David |date=28 December 2016 |publisher=Huddersfield Town AFC |accessdate=15 February 2017 }} He signed his first professional contract in February 2015, having already represented the under-21 team at the age of 17.{{cite news|last1=Thomson|first1=Doug|title=Teenage striker Rekeil Pyke signs contract at Huddersfield Town|url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/sport/football/news/teenage-striker-rekeil-pyke-signs-8726091|accessdate=8 July 2017|work=The Huddersfield Daily Examiner|date=26 February 2015}} He joined [[National League (division)|National League]] side [[Wrexham A.F.C.|Wrexham]] on a month long loan in November 2016.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38129396 |title=Rekeil Pyke: Huddersfield Town youngster joins Wrexham on loan |last=Williams |first=Aled |date=29 November 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 February 2017 }} He made his debut on 29 November in Wrexham's 1–0 defeat at [[Lincoln City F.C.|Lincoln City]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38060224 |title=Lincoln City 1–0 Wrexham |date=29 November 2016 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 February 2017 }} "Dragons" manager [[Dean Keates]] said Pyke "did okay... the physicality was all new to him, a new environment, but there is still a lot more to come from him".{{cite news|last1=Griffiths|first1=Rob|title=Wrexham AFC boss Dean Keates continuing to cast net wide in search for players|url=http://www.dailypost.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/wrexham-afc-boss-dean-keates-12264304|accessdate=8 July 2017|work=Daily Post|date=2 December 2016}} After three appearances at the [[Racecourse Ground]], Pyke returned to Huddersfield at the end of his loan spell on 28 December. On 30 January 2017, Pyke joined [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]] on loan until the end of the [[2016–17 Colchester United F.C. season|2016–17]] season.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38802317 |title=Rekeil Pyke: Colchester United sign Huddersfield Town forward on loan |date=30 January 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 February 2017 }} He came on as a second-half substitute for [[Owen Garvan]] to make his professional debut on 15 February during Colchester's 3–2 defeat to [[Crawley Town F.C.|Crawley Town]] at the [[Colchester Community Stadium]].{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38889789 |title=Colchester United 2–3 Crawley Town |date=14 February 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 February 2017 }} He made his first start in a 2–0 home victory over [[Mansfield Town F.C.|Mansfield Town]] on 14 March, after which "U's" manager [[John McGreal]] said he was "delighted" with Pyke, describing him as a "beast of a kid".{{cite news|last1=Waldron|first1=Jonathan|title=McGreal is delighted with "beast" Rekeil|url=http://www.gazette-news.co.uk/sport/15157690.McGreal_is_delighted_with__beast__Rekeil/|accessdate=8 July 2017|work=Gazette|date=15 March 2017|language=en}} He failed to score in four league starts and eight substitute appearances for Colchester.{{soccerbase season|93704|2016|accessdate=7 May 2017}} On 11 July 2017, Pyke joined League Two side [[Port Vale F.C.|Port Vale]] on loan for the entire [[2017–18 Port Vale F.C. season|2017–18]] season.{{cite news|title=Rekeil Pyke: Port Vale sign Huddersfield Town striker on loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40576442|accessdate=11 July 2017|work=BBC Sport|date=11 July 2017}} Manager [[Michael Brown (footballer, born 1977)|Michael Brown]] warned fans not to burden the teenager with too much expectation after Pyke scored four goals in his first two pre-season friendly matches.{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Port Vale: Brown urges fans not to burden Pyke with expectation|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/port-vale-michael-brown-urges-fans-not-to-burden-rekeil-pyke-with-expectation/story-30436604-detail/story.html|accessdate=13 July 2017|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=13 July 2017|language=en}} However he struggled to even appear on the first-team bench, and speaking in October, new manager [[Neil Aspin]] blamed league rules that prevented him from naming more than five loanees in a matchday squad.{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Michael|title=Neil Aspin sympathises with Port Vale's loan players|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/neil-aspin-sympathises-port-vales-617873|accessdate=12 October 2017|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=12 October 2017}} He then picked up a hamstring injury in a reserve team game and returned to the [[Kirklees Stadium]] for treatment.{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Michael|title=Port Vale's Rekeil Pyke back at Huddersfield with hamstring injury|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/port-vales-rekeil-pyke-back-687741|accessdate=27 October 2017|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=26 October 2017}} He was recalled to Huddersfield permanently on 2 January 2018.{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Michael|title=Port Vale loan pair Stobbs and Pyke recalled by Sheffield Weds and Huddersfield|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/sport/football/port-vale-huddersfield-sheffield-wednesday-1001686|accessdate=2 January 2018|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=2 January 2018}} On 10 July 2018, he returned to Wrexham on a season-long loan for the [[2018–19 National League|2018–19]] season.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44779538 |title=Wrexham sign Huddersfield Town striker Rekeil Pyke on loan |date=10 July 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=10 July 2017 }} He scored five goals in 27 appearances, being absent from [[Graham Barrow]]'s first-team only during a six week spell at Christmas when he was in recovery from a hamstring injury. He was recalled to Huddersfield on 30 January; Welsh newspaper ''[[The Leader (Welsh newspaper)|The Leader]]'' reported that "Pyke's departure is a big blow in Wrexham's push for a top-seven finish".{{cite news |title=Rekeil Pyke's loan spell at Wrexham AFC comes to an early end |url=https://www.leaderlive.co.uk/sport/wrexham_afc/latest/17396986.rekeil-pykes-loan-spell-at-wrexham-afc-comes-to-an-early-end/ |accessdate=30 January 2019 |work=The Leader |date=30 January 2019 |language=en}} On 30 January 2019, he moved up two divisions from Wrexham to join struggling [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] on loan until the end of the [[2018–19 Rochdale A.F.C. season|2018–19]] season.{{cite news |title=Rekeil Pyke: Rochdale sign forward on loan from Huddersfield Town |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47064215 |accessdate=30 January 2019 |work=BBC Sport |date=30 January 2019}} ==Style of play== Port Vale assistant manager [[Chris Morgan (footballer)|Chris Morgan]] said that Pyke was "quick and powerful" and had good finishing skills.{{cite news|last1=Baggaley|first1=Mike|title=Port Vale excited about loan of Huddersfield striker Rekeil Pyke|url=http://www.stokesentinel.co.uk/port-vale-excited-about-loan-deal-for-huddersfield-striker-rekeil-pyke/story-30430267-detail/story.html|accessdate=8 July 2017|work=Stoke Sentinel|date=8 July
